148592.description:
Hiding in these woods, there lies not just one Bigfoot, not a few Bigfoots, and not a gaggle of Bigfeet — but an entire community of Bigfootses. Now it's time to go in the woods with your trusty Bigfootses's call, cloak your scent with Bigfootses's urine, and get ready for adventure with aliens, yeti, the Loch Ness monster, and every other legendary creature you can think of.

Bigfootses, The Card Game consists of two decks: the Woods Deck (75 cards) and the Thingies Deck (75 cards). In the Woods Deck, you encounter Bigfootses and creatures to battle, and draw events that can dramatically change the game. The Thingies Deck is full of equipment, items, actions, and card modifiers to help you along in your quest. Also included are 10 professions, ranging from the practical to the absurd.

Your goal? Be the first player to corral ten Bigfootses to win the game!
148592.name: Bigfootses, The Card Game

148593.name: Japanese Garden
148593.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a full-color, 24 x 20 inch, floor plan of a Japanese Garden, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

This Product includes the VTT files for online play.

Includes a 360° View of the map.

Game Masters need quality maps for their miniatures. DramaScape™ is committed to bringing Game Masters the maps they need.

“Did you think you were really safe in this place? There is nowhere you can go where we cannot find you.”

The Japanese garden is a single map of a small walled garden. The product includes image files for use with your virtual tabletop (VTT), as well as a 360-degree panoramic view from the center of the garden.

The Japanese garden is intended for use in Eastern themed fantasy games. It can also be of use in any historical game set in Japan from 800 A.D. up to the modern day.

The Japanese garden is a place of relaxation and contemplation. The group could be on vacation here, when their enemies suddenly decide to spring an attack on them as they rest. The Japanese garden has multiple rock formations, pillars, trees, bridges, rails, chairs, and other objects that can be interacted with, making it perfect for a martial arts fight with lots of acrobatic maneuvers and improvised weapons.

Another idea is the pool itself. Does the dark pool conceal an unseen or hidden monster within that will ambush visitors to this peaceful place?

148594.description:
Road To Rabaul is a scenario and campaign book for the popular CHECK YOUR 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. The book provides four campaigns and 24 scenarios under one cover. The first campaign (5 scenarios) follows the beginning of the Japanese air campaign against Darwin, Australia from February to June 1942. The second campaign, recreates the desperate defense of Port Moresby, New Guinea from March to August 1942 with 5 scenarios. The third campaign (7 scenarios) focuses on the 5th Air Force assault on Japanese bases along the north coast of New Guinea in 1943. The last 7 scenarios concentrate on the US Navy and Marine Corps attacks against Rabual. The book also features some of WWII’s legendary aces including Thomas McGuire, Greg Boyington, George Welsh, Hiroyoshi Nishizawa, Shogo Takeuchi, Peter Turnbull and Les Jackson.

HISTORICAL RESEARCH: This book includes several introduction sections containing campaign historical background, plus a bibliography for further reading. A campaign map is included that displays campaign targets and airfield locations.

AIRCRAFT STATISTICS and CAMPAIGN INFORMATION: This book contains aircraft statistics for 18 Allied and Japanese aircraft in CHECK YOUR 6! format for use in the scenarios. The book also contains detailed notes and rare pictures of the various aircraft featured in the campaign.
148594.name: Check Your 6! Road to Rabaul

148595.name: Race the Sun
videogameversion: PlayStation 4 / PlayStation 3 / PlayStation Vita PSN edition
148595.description:
FAST FACTS

- Nearly half a million plays on Kongregate (early alpha demo)
- Funded on Kickstarter ($20k+)
- 2.5 hours average session length (beta version)
- Powerful in-game world creator (focus on ongoing user-content)
- Unique cooperative relay mode (highly social)
- Keyboard, gamepad, or BrassMonkey controls

THE CORE GAME

Race The Sun is a high-speed game that uses simple controls and is set in a procedurally generated world. The goal is to get the highest possible score by racing into the sunset, avoiding obstacles and enemies, and collecting speed boosts and other powerups to help you along the way. You fly a solar-powered craft, and the game ends at sundown, if you can make it that far!

THE SIMPLEX WORLD CREATOR

The world creator is included right in the game, allowing anyone to make unique new game modes (or modify existing ones) and share them with the Race the Sun Community. Unique interactive objects can be created, styled, and animated – with no programming knowledge. These could be simple things like falling blocks, or more detailed things like a flock of birds.

CO-OP MULTIPLAYER

Multiplayer in Race the Sun takes the forms of an asynchronous, co-op, relay race. Here’s how it works:
When your round ends, you can share your progress with other players via a hyperlink. This allows another player to pick up where you left off and continue the run. When they die, they will be able to share a link, and so on, and so forth. The process repeats until 4 runs are completed, at which point your combined score is posted to a special leader-board.

Source: The Game Website.

The Lamia Lies Down on Broadway

Alarums & Excursions

148597.name: Rapture's Voyage
148597.description:
From the box:
Will he be a heartless seafaring scoundrel... or the Captain of her dreams?

[...] Friendless in the midst of a turbulent sea, Abigail finds herself utterly defenseless. She must face the tyranny of a merciless task master while burning with a secret desire fueled even by his slightest touch.

[...] Like most sea captains, Lord Jonathan expects his women to be like his ship... at his total command. [....] However, could a smoldering tide of passion provoked by Abigail's innocent sensuality transform the arrogant master into a willing servant?

User summary:
Rapture's Voyage is a pair of coordinated gamebook scripts for two player characters, Abigail Marie Charington and Lord Jonathan Coulter. Players read aloud from a script and make choices when prompted. Sometimes a spinner dictates the character's disposition (bold, cautious, etc.).

148599.name: Liberation of the Demon Slayer
148599.description:
from the designer's blog:
A gonzo, Lovecraftian, science fantasy quest through the devil-haunted Nether Realms! Or you could just go back to farming your stinking land...

from the Introduction:
Liberation of the Demon Slayer might be an “end of an aeon” mini-campaign. It’s definitely an “anything can happen” scenario of the old school gonzo variety, meant to last between 7 and 13 adventuring sessions, whereupon, the player-characters’ lives are irrevocably changed. Their old lives are over and done with. Liberation of the Demon Slayer is for those who want something different, a bit of science fantasy, a smidge of Lovecraftian darkness, and a huge dollop of classically weird gaming.

from the colophon:
Liberation of the Demon Slayer is an old school campaign guide and mega-dungeon created for use with virtually every fantasy paper & pencil tabletop roleplaying game.

148600.description: Players embark on a journey into the jungle in the footsteps of the ancient civilization Maya. Players will earn points for their treasure trove. In each round, players have four cards with available maps. In his turn, a player puts on the table his personal map (the card) held in the hand. Then he flips the selected card treasure lying on the table. A player gets points when the colour and the shape of treasures. After four rounds who has the most points is the winner.
148600.name: Wyprawa do dżungli
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

148601.description:
Not enough gas, not enough ammo or not enough time. Not enough to cross the Rhine before the enemy closes all the gaps. You need to form the bridgehead before others do. That’s the only way to Victory and your personal glory.

1944 Race to the Rhine is a new game experience. You can’t win this game without proper planning. Your tanks need gas to move and ammo to fight. But don’t forget to feed your GIs. So what would be your transport priority?

Will you follow General Patton’s strategy to discard ammo in order to bring additional fuel barrels along to move boldly forward? Would you risk your prestige and gamble on Market-Garden as Field Marshal Montgomery did? Would you cross the Rhine more quickly than General Bradley did, with the help of your hard work and a little luck?

“In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable” (General Dwight D. Eisenhower, Supreme Commander of the Allied Forces in Europe).

So, how are you planning your Victory?
148601.name: 1944: Race to the Rhine
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 32 -- Gum-sized Games and Ancient Tombs
Episode 33 -- Racing Tanks Like it's 1944
Pap under juletræet
Podblast: 1944 Race to the Rhine
TDT # 405 - Metagaming

148602.name: Grim World
148602.description:
From the Kickstarter:
Grim World is a dark fantasy supplement for the Dungeon World and Fate Core systems


7+ Dungeon World class playbooks
6+ Fate Core classes, with theme descriptions, aspects, and stunts
15+ Playable Species with custom moves, free aspect invokes, and portrait illustrations
Grim World setting tips and GM philosophies
The Hunt faction details about their structure, hidden caches, lodges, hunting trophies and contracts
8+ DW style Compendium Classes to flesh out your characters
7+ GM Fronts/Arcs for building a campaign
Grim World locations and the Grim World Location Builder (roll some dice for an instant adventure location)
20+ Monsters with descriptions, instincts, weaknesses, and portrait illustrations
Loads of gear including new magic items, cursed items, and a Cursed Item Toolkit (to build your own cursed magic items)
36+ (yes, 36 and counting!) additional Death Moves, including all standard DW classes, Inverse World classes, and tons for other custom classes (written by Jacob Randolph and other awesome contributors from the community)
Full page class illustrations, spot illustrations (for species, monsters, magic items), and additional icons and sketches, all to make Grim World come alive!

148605.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 135 - Nov 1986)
rpgissuearticle: The Lamia Lies Down on Broadway
The Puzzle of the Peregrinating Trolley
148605.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #135
November 1986

Cover art by John Kingsbury.

148606.name: Flugfeld Berlin-Gatow
148606.description:
User summary

A promotional flyer released by Pegasus Spiele and handed out at various conventions in German-speaking countries.

For such a small (and free) product, the flyer offers quite a bit of material, including background on an abandonned airfield, a map, and a scenario in which the player characters are asked to destroy or steal an aircraft from under the noses of a gang of sprawl guerillas.

148607.name: Dynatec
148607.description:
User summary

A promotional flyer released by Pegasus Spiele and handed out at various conventions in German-speaking countries.

For such a small (and free) product, the flyer offers quite a bit of material, including background on a matrix development corporation, and a scenario in which the player characters are asked to extract a key employee from the corporation.

148608.name: Mostrans
148608.description:
User summary

A promotional flyer released by Pegasus Spiele and handed out at various conventions in German-speaking countries.

For such a small (and free) product, the flyer offers quite a bit of material, including background on Baltic Sea smuggling and a scenario involving conflicts between smugglers and family ties.

148609.name: MovieMashups
148609.description:
A team game, where each team tries to determine the mashed up movie title.
Scoring is one point for each title guessed, and a bonus point for both titles. If there are points left over after the 1 minute round, the other team gets a chance to steal the remaining points. Whomever gets the most points gets the card. At the end of the game, you take the cards and try to make combos (most movies starring same actor, most in the same series, most in same genre).

As it's a team game, you will see one person knowing a title, announcing it, then the other team members using that title to guess the rest of the movies. Also, sometimes a player knows the movie but cannot remember its title, so will describe the movie to their teammates. Those are fun moments for me to see.

You will see an opponent anxiously watching the clock for opportunity to steal.

The numbers at the bottom of the card are used to create themed decks. This lets you use a sub-set of the cards you own to come up with a themed game.

148610.name: WWII: The Card Game
148610.description:
September 1, 1939 – For the second time in the 20th century, the world is at war. With the invasion of Poland by Germany, Europe plunges into war a mere 20 years after the end of The Great War, now to be known as World War I. Just over two years later, in December of 1941, the other half of the globe joins the war as Japan declares war on the United States and the British Commonwealth and tears through Western Pacific territories with astonishing ease. Will you save the free world as the Allies, or conquer it as the Axis?

WWII: The Card Game is a 2 player card game that pits the Axis against the Allied Powers in the Second World War. WWII: The Card Game is a constructed deck game in which both players construct their own deck before the game begins and then use their deck to wage war on their opponent. During the game, players build their resources and deploy military units to take control of locations by defeating their opponent’s units in battle. By winning battles and controlling key strategic locations around the world, players cause their opponent to lose cards from their deck. The first player to empty their opponent’s deck is the winner!

148611.description:
Just start and get into the party game. Re-experience Tabu. This little edition of cards (22 cards of double-sided cards with terms and one rule card) is a stand-alone playable game of Tabu. It can also be used as very small expansion to the base game.

It has quick and easy rules like just set up two teams and explain the card given from the other team to your team members in 30 seconds. If you did it successfully your team scores 1 point; if not, or if you use one of the "Tabuwords", you get nothing.

(from back of the box and user summary)
148611.name: Tabu: Deine Tabu Special-Edition

148612.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 136 - Dec 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Son of I Ching, You Claudius
The Lamia Lies Down on Broadway
The Puzzle of the Peregrinating Trolley
148612.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #136
December 1986

Cover art by Ursula Andersen.

148613.name: L'Âme damnée d'Ernest Pico
148613.description:
user description

Free adventure for the French version of Call of Cthulhu (6th Edition).

148614.name: La légion perdue de Rome
148614.description:
user description

Free adventure for the Hollow Earth Expedition RPG.

148615.name: Gringo: Polar Bear
148615.description: Promotional set for 7th player to Gringo - Polish edition of Skull & Roses.

148616.name: Threshold (Issue 1 - Sep 2013) Karameikos
rpgissuearticle: 30 Years Anniversary of Red Box D&D
Mirror of the Eternal Night: Secrets of Koskatep
Noble Houses of Karameikos: Strolojca and Draconius
The Dangers of the Dymrak Wilds
148616.description:
cover blurb:
The first issue of the new magazine for Mystara, featuring Adventures, NPCs, Organisations and Maps for Karameikos plus Interviews, Comics and features about your favourite world.

Table of Contents:

Editorial...............................1
This Issue s Authors....................2
30 years Anniversary of red Box D&D.....4
The Demography of Karameikos............6
The History of Karameikos..............37
Karameikos - The Hidden Years..........70
Thorn s Mystara........................74
Bruce Heard Interview..................82
Unveiling the Radu Clan................87
Strolojca and Draconius................92
Yuri Molotov - Death Knight...........114
The Rise of Dhrom Dhum................119
The Dangers of the Dymrak Wilds.......126
Fort Doom.............................131
Mirror of the Eternal Night...........144
Return to the Ice Wall................158
Guild Wars............................167
Time s Travels........................174
Artwork Sources and Credits...........176
Next Issue............................180

148617.description:
In What?!? Oh... Couples Banter, players turn quibbles into jokes, bickering into banter, and all around ridiculousness into a winning distraction. It's a game of easy improv where the sport of talking meets the challenge of listening.

Each card has either a simple phrase, a fill-in-the-blank phrase, or an action. As players play their cards back and forth, a conversation is created on the fly. Listen carefully for Questions and Demands or you will lose the round!

It's a game for anyone that likes to talk.
148617.name: What?!? Oh...
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Party Gamecast Reviews - What?!? Oh...

148618.name: Table Pack 1: Medieval Madness and Bride of Pin•Bot
148618.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Medieval Madness was released in 1997 by Williams, where you play the role of a medieval knight. The table's goals revolve around rescuing damsels in distress, fighting trolls and firing catapults at a castle!

Bride of Pin•Bot was released in 1991 by Williams and is the second in the Pin•Bot trilogy of tables. On this table, the goal is to transform Pin•Bot's bride, giving her speech, sight and eventually a transformation into human form. The table also has a Billion Point shot - the largest scoring feature in pinball history.

148619.name: Table Pack 2: Cirqus Voltaire and Funhouse
148619.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Cirqus Voltaire was released in 1997 by Bally. The goals of the table are to complete various tasks within the Cirqus - Juggling balls, walking the high wire, performing acrobatics, etc. The table features a Ringmaster which rises out of the bed of the table, carrying the ball on his hat and must be hit several times to be defeated.

Funhouse was released in 1990 by Williams. A talking head called Rudy is the star of this table. He speaks to the player and follows the ball with his eyes. The main goal of this table is to hit targets that advance the clock to midnight, which sends Rudy to sleep. Sending the ball into his mouth as he snores starts a multiball mode which offers the chance to score big points!

148620.name: Table Pack 3: Monster Bash and Gorgar
148620.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Monster Bash was released in 1998 by Williams and features six iconic Universal Studios monsters playing in a rock band! The goals of the table involve waking the monsters and supplying them with their instruments. The table featured a 'phantom flip' feature where the table would play shots without the user touching the flippers!

Gorgar was released in 1979 by Williams, and was the first talking pinball machine, with a vocabulary of seven words which are linked into short phrases such as "Gorgar hurt" or "Me got you!". The table features a battle between the player and a demon creature, the titular Gorgar. There is no music, instead the soundtrack is a heartbeat, which grows faster and faster as Gorgar grows closer to defeat.

148621.name: Circus Divas
148621.description:
In Circus Divas, a two-player dice-buying game, you play the owner of a Depression-era circus going from town to town parting fools and their money. But in order to do that, you need to hire some help and, ultimately, earn more than the rival circus that keeps hitting the same towns you do and draining your profits.

Each player can hire performers for his or her circus from a common pool. Those performers each allow the player to roll one additional die for profit, from the lowly d4 to the mighty - but unpredictable - d20. But these performers can prove to be real divas. When a performer rolls a 1, he or she throws a diva's tantrum and has to be consoled - or he or she will quit. And if you're consoling one diva, you can't console another if they should have a tantrum, so choose carefully.

The first player to reach $100 in savings wins. Play time takes about 15 minutes and requires at least one d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, and d20 to play. Counters for money are also helpful, but pencil and paper could work just fine. Enjoy it, and please let me know what you think!

148622.name: Escape From 26
148622.description:
Set in a strange world full of different cages, each one with its own number. Although beautiful and magical it’s also creepy and enslaving… Whomever is taking care of the cages had started to do it more and more rarely and now everything is on the verge of self decay. Out of nowhere you find yourself in one particular cage – number 26.

Source: The Publisher Website.

148626.name: Ascend: Hand of Kul
148626.description:
Ascend: Hand of Kul (formerly Ascend: New Gods) is a 2013 free-to-play game for the Xbox 360 and Microsoft Windows. It was unveiled at the Electronic Entertainment Expo 2012 during Microsoft's press conference. It is currently available in the Xbox Live Arcade.

The game features parallel multiplayer, wherein the player goes about his or her own single-player adventure, but can see other players going about their single-player adventures at the same time. The player cannot work together as in traditional co-op modes, but can purchase and send "blessings" and "curses" to one another.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ascend: Hand of Kul", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148627.description:
Smooth flat surface protects gaming accessories during game play. Soft cushioned (mousepad-like) material grips snug to smooth areas.

29-1/4 in. x 16-3/8 in.
boardgameaccessory: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Original Series
148627.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Original Series – Game Mat

148628.description:
The "beautiful game" meets ancient mythology in the tactical board-based card game Age of Soccer as victory depends on getting the right balance between your player and action cards as well as a healthy dose of good fortune from the ancient deities. Will the deities reward their favorite players with divine powers? Or will they favor your opponents? Only time and skill will tell.

Age of Soccer is a card and hand management style game. Players are tasked with building their team's strength by recruiting new player cards in addition to adding powerful action cards to help influence a match and defeat opponents.

At the beginning of your turn, you must choose between strengthening your squad with new player cards or strengthening your hand with new action cards. Players use special training cards to help train their team or cause trouble for their opponents. Then players battle opposing teams using special match cards, trying to defeat them and gain a vital trophy.

Once a player has defeated all other teams in the game, he is crowned the champion of Age of Soccer.
148628.name: Age of Soccer

148630.name: The Contested Isle: The Hibernian Tribunal
148630.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The magi of Hibernia respect the land and its supernatural inhabitants, granting much of the Tribunal's area to hedge traditions and allowing supernatural creatures a vote at Tribunal. Now, magi from elsewhere in the Order have come to "reform" the Peripheral Code, laying siege to and taking one of the Irish covenants. If the native magi could stop fighting each other, they would resist. As English lords push further into the island, and the Church struggles with attempts to make it fit continental ideals, the Order of Hermes faces its own conflict. The traces of past conflicts are everywhere: the faerie Tuatha De Danaan, the magic Fir Bolg and Formorach, and saints as prone to curse as bless. Demons, however, are nowhere to be seen, as constant fighting convulses the Emerald Isle. It is, as ever in Ireland, a time for heroes.

148632.description:
Draw Blood is a rummy-style card game for 2-3 players, with a deck that consists of 54 cards: three types of monsters (Vampires, Werewolves and Water Monsters), three "Kill" cards (for killing your opponent's Monsters), and 36 numbered blood cards.

Like most rummy games, the object of Draw Blood is to be the first player to get rid of all the cards in your hand. To do this, players can lay down melds of sets and runs; unlike other rummy games, however, you can't just lay down melds whenever you want. You must play a monster card first. Knowing when to play monsters is a key strategy, but you also have to figure out when to kill your opponent's monsters to prevent them from laying down their own melds.

The numbered blood cards come in two colors: odd numbers are black and have a skull in the right corner, while even numbers are red and have a heart in the right corner. You can kill your opponent's monsters with a Kill card or a three-of-a-kind of skulls. With a three-of-a-kind of hearts, you can bring one of your monsters back to life. Blood cards can also be played as melds for points, and deciding whether to play for points or to kill your opponents becomes a key strategy in the game.

The first player to play out his cards ends the hand, then everyone tallies his score. Whoever first reaches a preset point total wins!
148632.name: Draw Blood

148634.name: Amnesia (Fate)
148634.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forget everything. Remember nothing.

Grasp at everything mnemonic that wriggles like a fish inside your skull, behind your eyes, and between your hemispheres. Pluck out a memory to devour. Embrace.

This Game Master's adventure supplement fills in a few gaps - or makes more - for player characters in The Demolished Ones. Memories, Aspects, and Stunts march about these pages for you the GM to seize, then pour inside the waiting past of the minds at your gaming table. They might hate you for it. They might quicken with the savory shudder of something wrong and forbidden. The experience is delicious either way.

148636.name: Keep of Count Habbish
148636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here's a free GM adventure from the potent pen of the celebrated Trollhallan Trrrommm, complete with NPC character cards. Cuzax the Courageous is hiring hardy warriors - earn the money, take the risk, live long and prosper (with a little luck).

148637.description:
This is a free promo available at Spiel 2013.

It includes a Double Buy card that counts as two Buy cards. After being used, the card must be passed to the player on your left.
148637.name: Briefcase: Double Buy

148638.name: Jailbait: Hero For Hire
148638.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's tough surviving in the big city when you've run out of money and can't find a job you really want to do (it's not much fun cleaning out stables) so when an admittedly strange person comes up to you offering the chance to earn serious coin who would turn it down? Especially when the job calls for a hero and you're sure you fit the bill.

Breaking into the Khaboom City Dungeons might be possible, especially with the funky key you've been provided with, even if it does mean a trip through the sewer system, but can you be sure that if you do go in you'll ever get out?

And what about the prisoner you're supposed to release? Just who or what do they keep on the maximum security level? Good luck - you'll probably need it!

Hope that's enough to set the scene (or bait the trap!).

148639.name: Founders of the Empire
148639.description:
Three hundred years before the Common Era, the shores of the Mediterranean Sea are inhabited by dozens of peoples, but only one of these nations is destined to found a great civilization that will spread from Egypt to Britannia. Take up the reigns of rule in your hands and prove that you are the only one worthy to unite half the world under your banner!

In Founders of the Empire, each player expands his own domain using four types of square tiles:


Green tiles represent natural landscapes: forests, cliffs, lakes, etc. They can be added to the players' domains freely. These tiles provide basic resources: wood, stone, plants and water.
Blue tiles are village buildings that require specific natural resources. For instance, the mine (which provides gold) should be placed next to stone and water sources.
Purple tiles represent city structures: marketplaces, inns, workshops and army camps. They also should be placed next to other tiles that give certain resources. In addition to providing corresponding resources, city tiles give their owners action tokens that can be used at any point of the game.
Red tiles are temples and altars that give players victory points. They are of different values (from 1 to 3 points) and require different combination of resources.


A player's turn consists of three phases. First, the player must add a new tile from the stack to the common market. Then, he has the option of playing one of his tokens; these tokens are able to buy opponents' resources, pillage enemy tiles, transfer resources between tiles, and convert resources to victory points. Finally, the player must add a tile from the market to his domain. The game ends after all red tiles are added to the players' domains. Each player calculates victory points from his temples and tokens, and the player with the most points wins.

148640.name: Deathbed
148640.description:
From publisher blurb:

This one is quite different...starting with a bump in the night and then things only go downhill from there! You can play whoever and whatever you like, just not expect things to stay the way they started...still, where there's a will there's normally a way (just that it's a bit creepy).

Nice guys won't prosper if they act nice!

You'll find a twist to the rules and something that you can play over again and easily add to if you feel like stirring the pot or putting flowers on the grave...

148641.description:
Yōkaï no Mori contains two simpler versions of Shōgi to introduce the game to new players and youngsters.

In ''Dōbutsu Shōgi, which means "animal shogi", each player has only four pieces – chick, giraffe, elephant and lion – and they're trying to either catch the opponent's lion or move their own lion to the opposite side of the game board. The board is just 3×4 squares, so the game is rather short. As for how to play:


The giraffe moves one space orthogonally.
The elephant moves one space diagonally.
The chick is directly analogous to the pawn/soldier of Shōgi and can be promoted to a full-grown chicken, equivalent to the gold general in Shogi.
The lion is analogous to a king in Chess, except that he can win through promotion as long as it doesn't leave him in check.
Even on this 3×4 board, you are still able to drop in pieces that you captured from your opponent!
Unlike in Shōgi, you can drop a chick for mate or have two chicks in a column.


Goro-Goro Dōbutsu Shōgi has a larger 5×6 game board with each player having eight pieces (3 chicks, 2 giraffes, 2 elephants and 1 lion). The game also adds more rules from the full Shōgi game, in particular:


You win only by capturing your opponent's lion, not by reaching the opposite side of the game board.
You can't have two of your own chicks in the same column/file.
You can't drop a chick for mate.


The Japan Shogi Association created the rules for Goro-Goro Dōbutsu Shōgi in order for players to learn important concepts in Shōgi, such as how to handle the generals effectively, why pawn promotion is so important, and how to mate the opponent's king with successive piece drops.
148641.name: Yōkaï no Mori
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 5: Patchwork

148642.name: Eador Genesis
148642.description:
User Summary

A Strategy game developer by Alexey Bokulev and released in 2009, later translated to English and released on GOG in 2012. Gameplay can be compared to Heroes of Might and Magic or Age of Wonders explore a large map while fighting enemies, bribe enemies, cast spells, recruit allies, and equip heroes while trying to take control of the map from others.

Combat is hex based and features a large variety of units and spells to use in battle.

148643.name: Praedor (1st edition)
148643.description:
user summary:
Praedor RPG is one of the most sold finnish RPGs ever, this first edition had two print runs before the revision and 1.1 edition.

Translated from back of the book:
It is unknown whether Jaconia belongs to past or future. In some eternal universe it just is. Jaconia is a big round piece of free land in the middle of a long dead, dark civilization's ruins. Jaconia is surrounded by Borvaria, kingdom of death, miljons of square kilometers of ancient ruined city. Nobody knows what lies behind Borvaria, some religions say there is nothing at all. Borvaria is dead land. Eternal dark force and nameless creatures make it a dark hell. Praedors are adventurers who earn their living by robbing and pillaging the ruins of Borvaria and Warth.

'Praedor is a fantasy roleplaying game based on the world of Petri Hiltunens graphic novels with the same name. It tells about Jaconia, fragment of a world, left in the middle of the ruins of a super-culture, devastated by an ancient curse. It tells about praedors, talented and courageous adventurers, who make trips to the ruins of Borvaria in hope of treasures. They are the heroes and villains of legends, envied and hated upstarts. Among them, high and low are equal, because monsters and demons don't care about family trees.

Jaconia is also a lot more, nothing prevents you from playing crooked nobles, acid-burned alchemists, thiefs of big cities, clergy men, cultists et cetera. Almost 100 pages of World book is a great source for anyone interested in Jaconia. The whole book is awesomely illustrated by Petri Hiltunen himself and includes 15 comic pages describing different parts of Jaconia.

Game rules and text parts are made by Ville Vuorela, who's earlier creations are Miekkamies, Taiga and Mobsters and many projects using RPGs in higher education. Rules are easy to learn, but very detailed if needed. Values are easy to change to be compatible with other RPG systems or to take in use in another environment or game world.

148644.name: Das Grauen von den Sternen
148644.description:
User description

This adventure was originally scheduled to be releases as part of the adventure compilation Lovecraft Country Collection 2: Grauen in Arkham for Call of Cthulhu but did not make it into the publication.
German publisher Pegasus decided to publish the adventure for free on their webpage.

148645.name: Parhaaseen Katseluaikaan
148645.description:
user summary:
Finnish translation of Primetime Adventures (1st edition) by Eero and Markku Tuovinen and extra illustrations by Jari Tuovinen, published by Arkenstone publishing. This translations adds 20 example TV-series formed into suggestions for game ideas and a short rules appendix.

148647.name: Constant Vigil
148647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can you follow orders unquestioningly? Unquestionably not! This is the story of the Hurricane, the man the authorites came to blame. If you like your merchants rich then Davor Pisk is worth risking terminal brain damage for, just as his mincetaur bodygaurds would do without question. Watch out for Wizard Control - they shoot to kill.

54 paragraphs of headlong fun you hardly need shake a rulebook at.

If you have never played Tunnels & Trolls, make this the first day of the best part of your life!

148648.name: Deception: Strangebrew's Chambers of the Unknown
148648.description:
From publisher blurb:

A solitaire adventure with the choice of folowing the path of good or bad plus all you need to play it as a GM adventure.

Classic dungeon struggle to defeat the mad tyrant or a series of battles against mighty champions to bring down the city and its Mayor - which side of the fence are you on?

148649.name: Ranger Than Fiction
148649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wondered what it would be like to be a world champion archer?

It's the longest day of the year and you get the chance to make those trolls dance, clap and sing to your prowess with the bow. Can you beat the other contestants?

Give it your best shot, champ!

148650.name: Pressure Drop
148650.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fast flowing Tunnels and Trolls solo anatomical adventure for those who rush in where angels fear to tread!

148651.name: Twelve Labours of Herakles
148651.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Tunnels & Trolls GM setting and a history/mythology lesson to boot. Do you have a mighty warrior in your stable of heroes? Good! The demi-god Herakles needs some time out for family reasons and he's paying handsomely for a stand-in. If you have a friend to be your second and your advisor, that would be a wise precaution but don't let him/her interfere and take over. Remember, these labours are yours and yours alone.

Good luck and may the gods be with you...

148652.name: Fleabitten: Neither Here Nor There
148652.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Tunnels & Trolls GM setting and a history/mythology lesson to boot. Do you have a mighty warrior in your stable of heroes? Good! The demi-god Herakles needs some time out for family reasons and he's paying handsomely for a stand-in. If you have a friend to be your second and your advisor, that would be a wise precaution but don't let him/her interfere and take over. Remember, these labours are yours and yours alone.

Good luck and may the gods be with you...

148653.name: Big Red and Little Red
148653.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Tunnels & Trolls GM adventure with a fabulous Jeff Freels cover by Douglas Mitten (Trrrommm).

Designed for 4 or more L3+ characters.

148654.name: Bengalia
148654.description:
Publisher blurb:
RPG made to help understand the problems of global economics, globalization and exploitation of child labour and connections of these.

The game has also been developed with a board of teachers and secretary of foreign affairs ministry of Finland.

148655.name: Khaboom Wizards' Guild Spell Books
148655.description:
From publisher blurb:

The WIzards' Guild in Khaboom has recently overhauled its spell books. All Level One spells are taught to wizards who graduate from WIzards' School. Spells above Level Six are taught by negotiation; lower levels are available to be taught without appointment. Strictly no credit given.

148656.name: The Common Kindreds of the Four Continents
148656.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trollworld exists in many different universes. In my universe, there are four continents on Trollworld - the Dragon, Eagle, Kraken and Wolf - and the common, 'good' kindreds have evolved differently on each one. These variations are not so great nad have mirrored the changes in the rule books - the evergreen, ever-popular 5.5, the grroundbreaking 7.5 and the shape of things to come, dT&T.

148657.name: Khaghbboommm 2012 Tunnels & Trolls Omnibus Edition
148657.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six Pack Special - Five solos and 1 GM adventure.

Going deep inside in Pressure Drop, relive childhood with Fairyland, understand Gericault's masterpiece with Adrift on the Ocean, get a grip on the Trollworld political scene with Rotten Borough with its all-new Dirty Tricks options, see if a specialist can ever go wrong in Ranger Than Fiction and then get some friends and give evelotion a helping hand in Ice Exile

148658.name: Khaghbboommm Almanac 2013
148658.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gathered here for your delight and confusion are house rules, stories, dungeons, rules comparisons, maps and (frankly I've forgotten exactly what or simply do not have the attention span at my advanced age) many other oddities from my adventures in Trollworld these last few years. Many dedications too.

109 pages of bewildering balderdash - good luck, you'll need it!

148659.name: Pandemic: The Board Game
videogamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
148659.description:
As skilled members of a disease-fighting team, you must keep four deadly diseases at bay while discovering their cures. Travel the world, treat infections, and find cures.
You must work as a team to succeed. The clock is ticking as outbreaks and epidemics fuel the spreading plagues. Can you find all four cures in time? The fate of humanity is in your hands!

Pandemic: The Board Game is a family-friendly cooperative game. Pandemic: The Board Game puts you in an apocalyptic situation where you must work as a team to save the world.

In Pandemic: The Board Game each player has a unique role with different abilities. On a turn, players will have four actions in order to cure diseases and save the world. They can remove disease cubes from the board; fly to a city in need; trade cards with fellow players; and much more.

At the end of every player’s turn, new cities are infected with disease cubes and Epidemics may arise. You must fight to prevent the outbreaks before they spin out of control.

While there are many ways to lose, there is only one way to win: cure all four diseases before you run out of time!

148660.name: Clumsy Thief
148660.description:
A hilarious, fast-paced card game reinforcing double digit addition skills.

The cards consist of various money cards and a few thief and jail cards. The goal is for players to collect the most money. The game starts with players making piles of two cards that add up to $100. Once these starting piles have been made, the stealing can begin. You can steal a pile by putting a money card on top of the pile but the total of the top two cards must always equal $100. Slide the stolen pile to your side of the table. Piles can be stolen over and over again. A Thief card can steal a money pile. A Jail card can steal a pile with a Thief card. The player with the most money when the cards run out wins.

148661.name: Driver '76
148661.description:
From the Box:

Take to the streets of 1976 New York, in this action packed, Hollywood style driving game, where you can become the godfather of street racing.

148662.name: StateShift
148662.description:
From the Box:

Dynamically shift between 4 race states, 9 Intense tournaments, battle 15 fearless racers, unleash an arsenal of devastating weapons.

148663.name: The Pit Fighter Dungeon World Playbook
148663.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Fighting is in your blood. You were born to fight. And now you are are paid to fight.

Because the crowds love you, because they love to see you bleed, you oblige them whenever you can.

You are the Pit Fighter.

The Pit Fighter is a character class built for Dungeon World. He is designed to have a unique style of unarmed combat, based on some of the most popular gladiators on live action TV today!

148664.name: Fading Shadows
148664.description:
From the Box:

"Take control of the beam of light to guide the orb through an intriguing world of danger and adventure."

148666.name: LUDA Tischfußballspiel
148666.description:
This game from the 1960's from the German Demokratic Republic or from Poland is a soccer game for the table.
The game is for two gamers.
On the plastic playfield every gamer has 10 outfield players and 1 goal keeper in his team. The outfield players and the goal keeper have little springs under the feet and the gamers try to shut the little metal ball in the goal.
The winner is the gamer who had shot more goals in the playtime.

148667.name: Schattenstädte (Revised)
148667.description:
publisher blurb

In den dunklen Straßenschluchten der Megaplexe lockt das Geschäft. Wo sich versteckte Unterschlupfe finden und Schieber illegale Aufträge für ihre Konzerne vermitteln, sind Shadowrunner zuhause. Von hier aus starten sie ihre geheimen Operationen und erleben Abenteuer in der Sechsten Welt.

Schattenstädte ist ein Hintergrundband für Shadowrun 4, in dem ein paar der wichtigsten Megaplexe beschrieben werden: Seattle, Hamburg, Hongkong und - neu in dieser Auflage - Marseille. Sie alle eignen sich durch ihr einzigartiges Flair besonders gut als Hintergrund für eine klassische Shadowrun-Kampagne. Dieses Buch gibt umfassenden Überblick über verschiedene Stadtteile, interessante Orte und die Machtkämpfe, die zwischen Politik, Konzernen, Syndikaten und Straßengangs toben. Zudem sind Kurzdossiers zu Kapstadt, Caracas und Istanbul enthalten, sowie zahlreiche Abenteuerideen und Tipps, mit deren Hilfe man beliebige andere Städte als Schattenstädte verwenden kann.

Diese neue Auflage von Schattenstädte ist für die beschriebenen Megaplexe aktualisiert bis zum Jahr 2072



Translation courtesy of Google:In the dark canyons of the megaplexes, the business attracts. Where to find hidden hideouts and fixers slide illegal orders for their corporations, Shadowrunners are at home. From here, they start their secret operations and experience adventures in the Sixth World.

Schattenstädte is a background sourcebook for Shadowrun 4, in which a few of the main megaplexes are described: Seattle, Hamburg, Hong Kong, and - new to this edition - Marseille. They all are with their unique flair particularly good as a background for a classic Shadowrun campaign. This book provides an comprehensive overview of various parts of the city, places of interest and power struggles raging between politicians, corporations , syndicates and gangs. In addition, short chapters on Cape Town, Caracas and Istanbul are included, as well as numerous adventure ideas and tips that will help you use any other cities as shadow cities.

This new edition of Schattenstädte updates information on the described cities to the year 2072


user description

Schattenstädte is the translation of Runner Havens with an added chapter on Hamburg in the shadows. The revised 2010 release by Pegasus also includes a translation of the chapter on marseilles from Capitales des ombres by French publisher BBE.


edition overview

Runner Havens was released in three different versions in Europe. All three add different city chapters to the ones on Seattle and Hong Kong included in the original:
Runner Havens (2006, fanpro US, 144 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong
Schattenstädte (2006, German translation by fanpro, 192 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Hamburg
Schattenstädte (Revised) (2010, German translation by Pegasus, 223 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Hamburg, Marseille
Capitales des ombres (2008, French translation by BBE) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Marseille

boardgameimplementation: Turbo Rally Card Racing: Thunder Track
148668.description:
Using your own 1:64 scale diecast cars, race opponents along rally themed card tracks that you create. The cards are expandable so you can challenge unlimited players and build courses as simple or as big as you can imagine.

On your turn, flip one track card over, and follow the signs as you race through jumps and obstacles toward the finish line. The first player to reach the winner's circle wins one of five trophies. Trophy winners earn performance upgrades like run-flat tires, off-road tires, turbo and driver agility cards that give boosts for one race.

RPM (Radical Performance Maneuvers) draw cards give players opportunities to boost ahead, burst through obstacles or sabotage opponents. Each player start with three RPM cards that can be played on theirs or an opponent's turn. Players earn more cards by landing on designated RPM track spaces. Multiple card combinations can be played to enhance effects or counter one another. RPMs last for one turn and include NOS, off-road tires, run-flat tires, green lights, tire spikes and sideswipes.

The player with the most trophies after five races is the tournament champion!
148668.name: Turbo Rally Card Racing

148669.name: Nubia
148669.description:
A board game that uses components of a checkers set. 24 pieces, 12 per player, and an 8x8 board. Layout: two diagonally opposite corners are labeled "camps;" a player's counters are arranged in a kind of fat cross around his or her camp.

Movement: pieces move as a rook in chess.
Capturing: this is done by moving away from an adjacent enemy counter. So, if at the start of your turn, an enemy piece is next to one of yours, you move away from it in a straight line to capture it.
Winning: the person who gets a counter onto the enemy's "camp" wins.

148670.name: Horus Adrift
148670.description:
An Edge of Space Adventure for 3 to 5 Players.

From the Introduction

Welcome cadets to the Space Maritime Corp. of the Confederacy of United Systems! I don’t know if you know this or not but we are in the middle of a war! A war with a species that does not feel does not care and will not hesitate to make you a burning pile of sweet meat! You have one chance, cadets, one small chance of living past your first encounter with these Bugs, and that chance is me!

I do not care who your mommy or daddy is, I do not care how much or how little money you have and I really don’t give a damn who you like to tangle with in the sheets! All I care about is making sure you virgins have the training, the balls and the brains so that when those bugs pop your cherry you won’t die!

Now, line up, get your gear, first exercise is at 1500 C-time!

148671.name: Ideas al Minuto
148671.description:
The object of Ideas al Minuto is to say as many ideas as possible in one minute.

In teams of 2-5, players receive challenges based on the cards that they draw. Within one minute, each team gives as many answers as possible on the same challenge, with the conditions changing each time thanks to drawn cards showing animals, characters, places and things. The first team, for example, might tell a story of a teacher who starts on an island and ends in a circus, while the next tells the story of a baker who begins in a hospital and ends in a submarine.

Each challenge card has a difficulty of 1-5, and team's score points based on this difficulty level. The team with most points at the end of the game wins.

148672.name: Fobal
148672.description:
From the web site:

"Fobal is a board game of questions and answers for all football lovers.

Contains 2400 questions divided into 6 categories: Selection Argentina, World Championships, International Football, National Football, Soccer Ascent, Phrases and Other.

In Fobal you'll find these football questions you always wanted to find ... in other words, Fobal is the game that you will be able to demonstrate the amount and quality of your footballing knowledge."

Offers two modes to play:

Categories Mode: will use the six columns of the center of the board and the goal is to be the champion in the most possible number, answer questions as indicated by the dice.

Tournament Mode: who add the most points from correct answer, after 19 questions wins.

148673.description:
Templar Queenie 1: The Messages & The Coins, a mini-expansion for Templar: The Secret Treasures, consists of two modules that can be used individually, together, or in combination with any other modules for the game.


The Messages: Shuffle the seven message tiles with the harbor tiles at the start of the game. Whenever at least one message tile is revealed when adding tiles to the harbor, each player can either score 2 VP or return a played character card to hand.



The Coins: If no coins are on the board when someone plays "The Bells" card, place one coin in each room. When a player ends his movement in a room with a coin, he collects that coin. Players score 1-12 VP at the end of the game depending on how many coins they have relative to other players.
148673.name: Templar Queenie 1: The Messages & The Coins

148674.description:
Templar Queenie 2: The Secret Letters, The Tapestries & The Lamps, a mini-expansion for Templar: The Secret Treasures, consists of three modules that can be used individually, together, or in combination with any other modules for the game.


The Secret Letters: Each player has one secret letter tile that he can discard to replay a (valid) character that's already in his discard stack. If unused, the secret letter tile is worth 3 VP at game's end.



The Tapestries: Each player has one tapestry tile that he can place in a room. When Remigius awards points in a room, anyone with a tapestry in the room scores twice as many points as normal, then all tapestries in the room are discarded. If unused, the tapestry tile is worth 3 VP at game's end.



The Lamps: Each player has one lamp tile that he can place in a room. When Remigius or Severus ends movement in a room with a lamp, the lamp's owner scores 2 VP, then reclaims his lamp, which can be placed again on a future turn.
148674.name: Templar Queenie 2: The Secret Letters, The Tapestries & The Lamps

148675.description:
Templar Queenie 3: The Catacombs, a mini-expansion for Templar: The Secret Treasures, consists of one module that can be used individually or in combination with any other modules for the game.


The Catacombs: This new room is placed adjacent to the game board. Players can pick up scrolls in the harbor, then deliver them to the catacombs to score 4 VP. In the advanced version of this module, a player must deliver one of signet rings in addition to the scroll; in addition to the 4 VP, he scores a bonus based upon how many of his rings are orthogonally adjacent to the ring just placed.
148675.name: Templar Queenie 3: The Catacombs

boardgameimplementation: Palacio de Viana: Las llaves de palacio
148676.description:
Templar Queenie 4: The Keys, a mini-expansion for Templar: The Secret Treasures, consists of one module that can be used individually or in combination with any other modules for the game.


The Keys: Each player has a key tile, and as long as he holds the tile, he gains 2 VP (instead of 1) when playing Porticus. He can discard the key tile to move his character, Remigius or Severus through a locked door. If he holds the key at game's end, it's worth 3 VP.
148676.name: Templar Queenie 4: The Keys

bgaccessoryversion: Shattered Timelines Current Total Pack edition
Updated Edition through Villains of the Multiverse
148677.description:
The first draft of Sentinels of the Multiverse included oversized villain cards that had the art for that villain and all of that character's game text on one big card. These 4" by 6" cards represent the villains from the core game, expansions, mini-expansions, and promos.

The First Edition (2012) contains all villains from before Shattered Timelines, the Shattered Timelines Update Pack contains the villains released in the Shattered Timelines expansion and reprints of some misprinted cards from the First Edition, and Shattered Timelines Current Total Pack contains all villains to date with the reprints instead of the misprints.
boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Ambuscade Villain Character
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Cosmic Omnitron Villain Promo Card
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Infernal Relics
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Mad Bomber Blade Villain Promo Card
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Miss Information Villain Character
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Tormented Ally Infinitor Promo Card
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Unstable Kismet Promo Card
148677.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards

148678.description: A pack of extra tokens for Sentinels of the Multiverse. Includes one sheet of round HP tokens (1HP, 5HP, and 10HP tokens), and one sheet of rectangular status tokens (start of turn/end of turn and +1 damage/-1 damage tokens).
boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse
148678.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Extra Token Pack

148679.description: A full-color, 2' x 4.6' playmat printed with specific positions for decks, character cards, and trash for up to 5 Heroes, the Villain, and the Environment. Printed on high quality, scratch-resistant vinyl, these mats roll up concisely and resist damage.
boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse
148679.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Playmat

148680.name: Shadowrun Einsteigerregeln v1
148680.description:
User Summary

Twenty-one pages of basic rules for Shadowrun released by Pegasus Spiele. This product has the same purpose as Catalyst's Shadowrun Quick-Start Rules, but was apparently developed independently by Pegasus for the German-language market. Similar in scope and design to Pegasus's offering Cthulhu für Einsteiger for Call of Cthulhu.

Later versions include the introductory scenario "freier Markt".

148681.name: Food Fight 4.0
148681.description:
Publisher blurb

Die Schlacht ums Essen beginnt JETZT!

Wenn der Hunger kommt, gibt es nur einen Ort (besonders dann, wenn in ca. einer Stunde die Sonne aufgeht), wo man so etwas zu Mampfen bekommt. Ein Ort, den jeder hasst und liebt: Stuffer Shack.
Jepp, der gute alte Stuffer Shack, wo ein Geruch zu finden ist, den man nicht einordnen kann (und wohl auch nicht will) und wo sich Zeug zum Magenverderben im Wert von Tausenden Nuyen befindet. Und als wäre das nicht schon genug, ist der Laden auch noch 24 Stunden am Tag, 7 Tage die Woche, 365 Tage im Jahr geöffnet.

Food Fight 4.0 ist ideal, wenn Sie nur mal kurz in das Kampfsystem von Shadowrun 4 schnuppern möchte, die Gruppe wenig Zeit hat oder die Spieler nach dem Run im Einsteigerregelwerk noch ein wenig Auslauf brauchen. Es ist eine einfache und schmutzige Schlägerei mit nur sehr wenig Handlung, speziell dazu gestaltet, um dem Spielleiter und den Spielern ein Gefühl dafür zu vermitteln, wie die Regeln von Shadowrun funktionieren. Kümmern Sie sich zu diesem Zeitpunkt noch nicht zu sehr ums Rollenspiel, sondern konzentrieren Sie sich nur aufs Würfeln und haben einfach Spaß daran.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The battle for food begins NOW!

If you get hungry, there's only one place (especially if in about one hour, the sun comes up) where you get something to munch. A place that everyone hates and loves: Stuffer Shack.
Yep, the good old Stuffer Shack, where smells are to find that one can not classify (and probably doesn't want to), and where there's stuff to ruin your stomach worth thousands of Nuyen. And as if not enough, the store is also open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

Food Fight 4.0 is ideal if you just want to briefly sniff the combat system of Shadowrun 4, the group has little time or the players need a little run after the run in the introductory rules. It is a simple and dirty brawl with very little plot, specifically designed to to give the game master and the players a feel for how the rules of Shadowrun work. Do not even bother this time around too much with role-playing, but concentrate only onto the dice and just have fun with it.


User description

Originally part of Shadowrun Quick-Start Rules, German publisher Pegasus released the legendary Food Fight as a free pdf.

148682.name: Geben und Nehmen
148682.description:
Publisher blurb

Weihnachten 2070 steht vor der Tür und nicht zum ersten Mal fragt ihr euch, ob die ganze Stadt verrückt geworden ist. Die große Werbeoffensive von DeMeKo hat bereits vor Wochen jedes vernünftige Maß weit hinter sich gelassen und gleicht immer mehr einem wahnsinnigen Gehirnwäschefeldzug. Kitschige Werbejingles donnern an jeder Straßenecke aus den Lautsprechern, unterbrochen nur vom ständigen Ho-Ho-Ho der Weihnachtsmänner. Armeen von Werbe-AROs bombardieren die Horden der Einkaufswütigen mit Schnäppchenangeboten und treiben sie wie hirntote Zombies durch die überfüllten Straßen und Kanäle zu den Konsumtempeln.

Aber Rettung naht: Heiligabend steht kurz bevor. Nur noch wenige Tage, dann werdet ihr friedvolle sechs Monate ohne Weihnachtswerbung durchleben können. Bis der ganze Wahnsinn wieder von vorne beginnt...



Translation courtesy of Google:Christmas 2070 is coming, and not for the first time, you wonder if the whole town has gone mad. The great advertising campaign of DeMeKo has left any reasonable measure far behind weeks ago and increasingly resembles an insane brainwashing campaign. Kitschy commercial jingles thunder on every street corner from the speakers, interrupted only by the constant Ho-Ho-Ho of Santa Claus. Armies of advertising AROs bomb shopping victims with hordes of bargain offers and drive them like brain-dead zombies through the crowded streets and canals to the shopping malls.

But salvation is near: Christmas Eve is imminent. Only a few days, then you will have peaceful six months to live through without Christmas advertising. Until all the madness starts all over again ...


User description

Winning entry of Pegasus' 2009 adventure competition for Shadowrun. Subsequently released as a free pdf.

148683.name: Freier Markt
148683.description:
Publisher blurb

Bereit für den Lauf in den Schatten?

Du wirst Deine Spieler in ihrer ersten Begegnung mit Schmidt zwischen die Fronten von Yakuza und Vory führen, die einen Machtkampf um illegale SimSinn-Chips austragen. Die Runner sollen einen entscheidenden Schlag in diesem Krieg führen ...

Keine Panik!

Du hast alles, was Du für einen spannenden und funktionierenden ersten Shadowrun benötigst: Die Kurzregeln findest Du oben. Das Abenteuer beschreibt hingegen eine Situation mit einem bestimmten Hintergrund, in der die Spielercharaktere aktiv werden können und sollen.
Der erste Schritt: Drucke Dir sich das Szenario aus und lies es in Ruhe durch, danach werden viele Fragen beantwortet sein, und es kann los gehen.



Translation courtesy of Google:Are you ready to run in the shadows?

You will lead your players in their first meeting with a Schmidt into the crossfire of Yakuza and vory, who are fighting a power struggle over illegal simsense chips. The runners are the decisive blow in the war ...

Do not panic!

You have everything you need for an exciting and functioning first Shadowrun: The short rules you can find above. The adventure, however, describes a situation with a specific background in which the player characters can and should be active.
The first step: print out the scenario and read it through in silence, then many questions will be answered, and off you go.


User description

Created as free introductory adventure to accompany the quic-start rules, it was later integratet into Shadowrun Einsteigerregeln.

148684.name: Uthars Land
148684.description:
Publisher blurb

Das PDF enthält zahlreiche kleine Ergänzungen und Spielhilfen, um die Geschehnisse der Überfahrt und die Anlandung noch weiter zu vertiefen.

Enthalten sind …

eine beispielhafte Expedition samt Kostenrechnung
Regeln zur Ausgestaltung des Lagerbaus, zur Wasser- und Nahrungsmittelsuche
zusätzliche Professionen, beispielsweise den Gorilla- und Schlangen-Tierkrieger, den Stammeskrieger der Jucumaqh und magische Tätowierer
passend dazu werden auch die magischen Fähigkeiten der Professionen beschrieben (z. B. die Wirkung der Zaubertätowierungen)
eine Liste mit uthurischen Handelsgütern und Anmerkungen zu aventurischen Waren
Szenarioideen und Mysterien für Uthurias Norden




Vielen Dank an alle, die uns ihre Wünsche und Vorschläge für das Bonusmaterial geschickt haben. Wir hoffen, dass wir einige Fragen klären konnten.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The PDF contains numerous small additions and game aids to deepen the events of crossing and landing even further.

Included are ...

an exemplary expedition, including cost accounting
Rules for the design of the warehouse building, on water and food search
additional professions, such as the gorilla and snake animal warriors, the tribal warriors of Jucumaqh and magical tattoo artist
accordingly, the magical abilities of the professions are described (eg the effect of magic tattoos)
a list of uthurian trade goods and comments about aventurian goods
Scenario ideas and mysteries for Uthurias north




Thanks to everyone who sent us their wishes and suggestions for the bonus material. We hope that we were able to clarify some issues.


User description

Additional material for A193: An fremden Gestaden published as a free pdf by Ulisses.

148685.description:
User summary:

A special release of Skirmish! The Scrambles containing both expansion packs Antimagic and Breakthrough for Essen Spiel 2013.
148685.name: Skirmish! The Scrambles plus expansions pack

148686.description: Space Station: Core Modules consists of two double-sided cards that add new core modules — Luxury, Military, Scientific and Support — to the game that are revealed when you flip your starting core module. Each module has a unique function.
148686.name: Space Station: Core Modules

148687.name: Wild Card Creator
148687.description:
User Summary:

Wild Card Creator is character creation software for Savage Worlds games.

Publisher Blurb:

Any PDF, Any Setting, No Extra Cost

Wild Card Creator can automatically import all of the character creation content from a Savage Worlds PDF you’ve purchased.

Works for Your Favorite Setting

Pinnacle Entertainment Group and 22 other companies have given permission for Wild Card Creator to support their full range of PDFs, so your favorite settings are sure to be supported.

Houserule to Your Heart’s Content

Designed with modularity in mind so you can easily add your own Races, Skills, Edges, Arcane Backgrounds, Gear, and other character options and then share them.

Made Exclusively for Savage Worlds

Built from the ground up by people who love Savage Worlds. Comes with Savage Worlds Deluxe and supports every aspect of it, from Arcane Backgrounds to third-party setting rules.

Output to Multiple Formats

Standard Savage Worlds statblock, "expanded" statblock, HTML/CSS custom character sheet, and even your favorite form-fillable PDF. Wild Card Creator can do it all!
Cross-Platform Support

Available for Mac, Windows, and Linux with iPad and Android tablet support to come

148688.name: Mounts
148688.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth volume in our new Mythic Monsters series, Mythic Monsters: Mounts brings you a full complement of amazing mounts for your heroes to tame, or to face bearing their greatest foes into battle. Fully TWENTY of your favorite mounts are here, updated for the mythic rules, and when we say updated we mean complete stat blocks. More than that, every noble steed has its own unique and exciting new mythic abilities, from a mythic pony’s inexplicable survival to a mythic nightmare cauchemar’s death’s ride, from a the aerial aid of a mythic hippogriff to the unbridled glory of a mythic pegasus champion.

This product includes mythic mounts of commonplace varieties like horses, camels, and riding dogs, as well as exotic mounts like the sleipnir, dragon horse, and triceratops, including advanced variants that take the basic creatures up to a whole new level, covering CRs from 1 to 15. In addition to these twenty mount stat blocks, Mythic Monsters: Mounts also includes mythic feats and path abilities geared toward mounted mythic characters and classes with mount-based abilities.

148689.name: Oozes
148689.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third volume in our new Mythic Monsters series, Mythic Monsters: Oozes brings you a dozen and one sinister scavengers and primordial predators to torment your PCs! Twelve of your favorite oozes are here, updated for the mythic rules, and when we say updated we mean complete stat blocks, yes, but more than that every globbulent horror has its own unique and exciting new mythic abilities, from an mythic id ooze’s psychotropic vapors to a mythic carnivorous blob’s skeletal liquefaction.

This product includes mythic oozes of commonplace varieties like the black pudding and gelatinous cube, as well as variants like the electric jelly and white pudding, made far more distinct in their mythic evolutions, covering CRs from 4 to 16. In addition to a dozen familiar oozy monsters, Mythic Monsters: Oozes also includes suggested alternate rules for dealing with some common ooze abilities as they interact with the mythic rules and mythic characters. To top it all off, Mythic Monsters: Oozes introduces an entirely new 13th mythic ooze, the swift and deadly quicksilver ooze, congealed from the divine forges of the gods themselves.

148690.name: Exotic Encounters: Treants
148690.description:
From publisher blurb:

This particular installment of Exotic Encounters focuses on the iconic treant. These paragons of nature may be fairly obvious homages to The Lord of the Rings’s ents, but that doesn’t make them any less of a staple of fantasy media, and tree-beings of all sorts are a fun and resonant part of fantasy. The first treant in this book, the jungle treant (CR 10), is more than just an ill-mannered treant from a more tropical clime: its long vines animate and lash out to trip or entangle foes, and its body serves as a host to several swarms of angry wasps. Even more terrifying, however, is the bonfire treant (CR 14), an evil, twisted treant that burns with a constant and hellish supernatural fire. Everything this creature touches bursts into flames, and such flames are all but impossible to extinguish as long as the creature still lives. The last treant in the book is the old growth treant (CR 16), a massive, towering treant from ancient times that can release a hail of deadly pine needles, and which daring adventurers can climb upon in order to better fight it.

148691.name: En Garde!  More Martial Classes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game
148691.description:
From publisher blurb:

En Garde!
More Martial Classes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Roleplaying Game

Fencer Alternate Class for a Caviler:
Gallantry is not dead nor is the time honored art of fencing. Armed with a rapier, the gentleman’s weapon, a fencer stands strong against those who would offend him. One by one he calls out the foes of his lords and slays them with panache and skill. Bound to the service of one of the noble orders, he defends its honor.
The fencer retains the challenge and some of the order abilities of the caviler while sacrificing the mount and tactical abilities. In return it gets grit that works with it's challenge, companion weapon styles (parrying dagger, case of rapier, cloak, buckler, and single sword).

Meister Archetype for Fighter:
Eschewing capability with armor, a meister gains more advanced skill in a variety of weapons. They gain a series of tricks based on intimate familiarity with the weapons at their command. They can serve as daring gladiators, weapon instructors, or masters-of-arms. Regardless of their role, none can deny them the title of “meister” (master).

Also featuring the myrmidon prestige class
10 new dueling weapons
A dozen new sword feats

148692.name: The Guild Companion (Sep 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Forgotten Realms Deities - The Dwarven Pantheon
148692.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

148693.name: The Guild Companion (Oct 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Forgotten Realms Deities - The Elven Pantheon
148693.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

148694.description:
The mad sorcerer Grislyk has stolen the Book of Lore from the elves and hidden it in his dungeon lair. As the elven warrior maiden Kora, you must brave three increasingly dangerous levels to recover the Book, destroy Grislyk’s magical Black Crucible, and slay the wizard himself. Magical artifacts will help you evade Grislyk’s traps and slay his army of goblins and skeletons, but you will also need your wits and a bit of luck, for knowing when to search, when to fight, and when to run is the only way to survive the DUNGEON OF DEADLIEST EVIL.

Dungeon of Deadliest Evil is a solitaire adventure game that takes all the essential elements of a classic dungeon crawl, like slaying monsters, finding powerful artifacts, and exploring a multi-level dungeon, and packs them into an easy-to-learn game that sets up and plays in 20 minutes.

Gameplay is based on a simple dice allocation mechanic. You have three abilities, Speed, Combat, and Defense, and at the start of each turn you must assign one of three dice (a d4, a d6, and a d8) to each of them. While the game involves a good deal of luck and dice-rolling, judicious dice allocation is the key to success. Victory is achieved by destroying the Black Crucible, retrieving the Book of Lore, slaying the evil wizard Grislyk, and finally leaving the dungeon alive.
148694.name: Dungeon of Deadliest Evil

148696.name: Project Breather
148696.description:
From the Publisher

"Project Breather" was created by Sophie Melchior in New Zealand. After facilitating a game of Hot War at the Fright Night horror convention in Wellington, she was good enough to assemble her notes, characters and handouts into a complete pack that contains a game creation sheet, character sheets and handouts.

148697.name: Hot War Quick-Play Demo v1.0
148697.description:
From the Publisher

The free 6 page demo pack centers around the team hot on the trail of a Soviet mole, highly-placed in the British government. But all is not as it seems... The PDF includes a script, background & character sheets and is ideal for running a 15 - 30 minute Hot War demo game.

148698.name: The Gyre
148698.description:
Publisher's blurb:
You’ve survived in the wastelands your whole life. You reckon there’s not much this atomic-soaked world can throw at you that you can’t handle. Surviving is one thing, but getting ahead means more than just playing it safe. You’ve got to explore, take chances, and grab the opportunities that come your way.

So when a landslide exposes some sort of ancient doorway, you know you need to hustle to explore it and get the loot before someone beats you to it. What could be more straightforward than that?

The Gyre pits 3-5 Mutant Future™ characters of any level against ancient technological challenges, secret horrors, and a race against time.

148699.description:
Titanium Wars: Confrontation, an expansion for Titanium Wars, adds the following to the base game:


41 new Arsenal cards: 25 units, 8 improvements, 8 buildings
6 new Planets / Events
4 new Leaders
1 mercenary card (for 1 vs. 1 mode)
New (replacement) Tactic cards (50)
New (replacement) summary cards (4)
The Versus Mode: 1 vs. 1 or team vs. team
148699.name: Titanium Wars: Confrontation

148700.name: Sickle Foot
148700.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first of our Free post apocalyptic creature downloads for The Mutant Epoch role-playing game

In the wild places, ruins, tangled woodlands and wastes of The Mutant Epoch era, excavators, scavengers, traders and nomads can bet on one certainty, that they will encounter never before seen beasts. The fast moving, bear sized, swearing Sickle Foot is just one of many all new creatures that player characters can run into while exploring The Mutant Epoch RPG.

148701.name: Red Harvester
148701.description:
From publisher blurb:

The red harvester is so named for its ability to appear from seemingly nowhere and reap a bounty of flesh.

Welcome to The Mutant Epoch, where humankind is no longer the top of the food chain. The Red Harvester is our second free Creature of the Apocalypse, and worse then the first critter we made available and defiantly not for the squeamish.

148702.name: Spikeback
148702.description:
From publisher blurb:

The size of a grizzly bear, the vaguely humanoid Spikeback is a genetically engineered bio-weapon of old ­-- which has evolved.

Now, exhibiting an occasional cybernetic implant or mutation, they move about the wastes of The Mutant Epoch in packs, and gorge on the flesh of other living things. Bad tempered, ravenous and cruel, this freaky creature of the apocalypse is our third nasty in this series.

Although crafted for the Outland System Game Mechanic, a GM can easily modify the Spikeback’s stats over into most any post-apocalyptic game system.

148703.name: Junk-Mobster
148703.description:
From publisher blurb:

As hated as is it is feared, the disgusting, vaguely humanoid, multi-limbed and many headed Junk-Mobster is here.

Our fourth and most disturbing creature of the apocalypse yet. This thing is the stuff of nightmares. Not only can it eviscerate opponents with its elongated, clawed arms, but it often tries to subdue potential mates with net and club, meanwhile unleashing a barrage of mental mutations. Although terrible, mercenary bands, bounty hunters and excavators alike often seek these mutant monsters out, eager to claim the lucrative bounty on them, as well as free prisoners and loot the Rubble-Gangsta’s trove.

148704.name: Shadow Master
148704.description:
From the Box:

Repel Shadow Master's advance forces using your armoured all-terrain vehicle. Then continue your post-apocalyptic blastfest on six off-world environments before facing the crazed wrath of the hungriest of the power-hungry - Shadow master.

16 extensive levels of rapid-fire action

Mission-specific objectives to be completed

8 upgradable weapons of destruction

Thousands of 3D-modelled alien enemies, comprising of over 60 creature types.

148705.description:
You were extremely excited when the Dungeon Construction Kit you had ordered finally landed on your doormat. That excitement lasted until the moment you opened the box. Unfortunately it seems that some evil blackguard had put a curse on it and you immediately found yourself inside your own kit. Now there's only one thing for it: construct your way out. And while you're at it, kill as many monsters and take as much treasure back to the real world as possible...

A print & play card game where each card can either be a room on the map or an action. The best rooms are generally also the best actions, so you have to choose which is the best way to use each card. The card pool allows you to see up to 12 cards at a time, of which up to 4 will be immediately available for play, so there is a limited opportunity to plan ahead.

Dungeon Construction Kit - Cursed! was designed for the 2013 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.
148705.name: Dungeon Construction Kit: Cursed!

148709.name: Seeking Dawn
148709.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heading high into the mountains, the PCs work to help Vulgrax and his allies create a new settlement. When Erasmus sends Red Mist assassins to hunt them down, the PCs must brace for the long haul, and prepare themselves for the inevitable conflict with its new totalitarian rulers.

Seeking Dawn is an adventure for Season II of the Great City: The Sinking adventure serial. It was designed using the Pathfinder RPG system and intended for a group of 9h-level Player Characters.

148710.name: Shotguns -n- Saddles
148710.description:
Publisher Blurb/Designer Blurb:

He sat tall in the saddle. His eyes, shadowed by a dusty wide brimmed hat, scanned the buildings in the valley. His features were rugged and handsome, and he had the look of a man who had seen more hardship than one his age should have. He was wide of shoulders and narrow at the waist where the gun hung loosely in its holster. The Colt was old, but well tended, with a worn grip that was the telltale sign of much use.
