Shotguns & Saddles (S-n-S) is a cinematic role playing game set in the American wild west. The player characters take the role of cowboys, drifters, the town sheriff, or other desperados. The referee creates adventures for these characters full of fast paced action, nail biting showdowns, and barroom shootouts!

S-n-S takes its cue from the movies, books, and TV shows that dramatized this period. It downplays the importance of specific dates and continuity while focusing on the romance, drama, action, and adventure of a good western tale. This allows the referee to include any of the trappings of the genre, whether historically accurate or not.

S-n-S uses old school type mechanics inspired by the earliest role playing game. The goal was to develop a familiar, simple, yet comprehensive set of rules that can be learned very quickly. While concise, you will find them extremely versatile and able to satisfactorily handle most situations with a minimum of confusion or guesswork.

rpg: Go Fer Yer Gun! Roleplaying in the Wild West
148711.name: Wrongdoings at Widow Winters'
rpgseries: Rusty Staple Games Western Modules Series (M)
148711.description:
from the introduction:
Wrongdoings at Widow Winters’ is a stand-alone, ready-to-run Wild West adventure. This scenario is well suited for a one-shot adventure playable in a single gaming session, for a party of about four to six 2nd to 4th level characters. It is also the first key event in the Saving Stetson City campaign described in Module M1 and can be run as the first episode of that campaign, but it is not necessary to have M1 in order to play this module.

148712.name: Flick Soccer!
148712.description:
Use Flick Soccer’s unique ‘after-touch’ ball control to try and hit the target like a real Pro. Only Flick Soccer gives you this level of complete control and pinpoint accuracy.

Featuring 5 modes of play, gorgeous graphics and an intelligent goalkeeper, Flick Soccer really is one of a kind.

Source: The Game Website.

148713.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 142 - Jun 1987)
rpgissuearticle: And in the Previous Campaign (1 of 2)
And in the Previous Campaign (2 of 2)
Back in the High Life Again
The Lamia Lies Down on Broadway
148713.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #142
June 1987

Cover art by Scott Ruggels.

148715.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 143 - Jul 1987)
rpgissuearticle: The Lamia Lies Down on Broadway
148715.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #143
July 1987

Cover art by Spike Jones.

148716.name: McDonaldland Match-Up
148716.description:
From the game box: Your McDonaldland® friends are here in 3 fun match-up card games! There's Ronald McDonald®, Big Mac®, Captain Crook™, Hamburglar™, and Birdie The Early Bird™. You'll match colors, numbers - even shadows - of your favorite McDonaldland characters to win. Box contains game rules for all 3 games and a deck of 35 playing cards.

Shadow Match™ - Players collect one character card each time they're the first to slap the matching shadow card. The first person to collect a full set of 5 character cards wins.

Match and Stack™ - On their turn, players try to match a card from their hand with the top card on the game stack. The first person who gets rid of all the cards in their hand wins.

Won-by-One™ - A solitaire game, the goal is to match all of the cards while placing them into 1 or 2 stacks.

148717.name: The Lone Ranger and Tonto
148717.description:
User summary:
A mini-supplement Shotguns -n- Saddles that adapts the classic television incarnation of The Lone Ranger and Tonto for use as NPCs. Includes The Lone Ranger's Creed and tips for game mastering The Lone Ranger.

148718.name: Colonel Douglas Mortimer
148718.description:
User summary:
A mini-supplement Shotguns -n- Saddles presenting one of the iconic characters from The Good, The Bad and The Ugly, Colonel Douglas Mortimer, for use as an NPC. Includes character background and game stats.

148719.name: The Gatling Decision (Shotguns -n- Saddles edition)
148719.description:
A silver dollar adventure
for Shotguns-N-Saddles
For 3-5 salty 3rd level characters

User summary:
This is an adaptation of a scenario originally created by David Bezio for use with Savage Worlds.

The characters are hired to deliver a package to the village of Privilegio. What appears to be a quick job for easy money turns into a moral crossroads for the characters when they discover that everything is not as it seems.

148720.name: Spirits -n- Spurs
148720.description:
from the introduction:
Spirits -n- Spurs adds the supernatural to your S-n-S game if you like a little weird with your west! The material presented here takes place in mythical Davestown Texas (but feel free to use your own town).

The characters take the role of members of a secret society like group called The Shadow Posse. The characters wield 5 mystical relics that help them to fight the supernatural “creatures of the shadows” that plague the town. Thing is nobody else in town knows anything about these creatures and the Shadow Posse has to work in secret, or everyone will think they are crazy!

148721.name: Afterlife
148721.description:
Afterlife is a narrative driven tabletop war gaming experience. The story of a near-future Earth torn apart by civil war after the collapse of the social order imposed by the Unity Council will be told over a number of separate volumes.

Earth burns as sprawling Mega Cities built for a world of prosperity become brutal war zones and the Unity Council’s authority crumbles away. Dozens of corporations, emergent governments and resistance movements form loose factions and alliances in battles for control of Earth’s resources and technology.

Each new Volume of Afterlife will expand on previously released Volumes, adding new miniatures and rules options, and continuing the narrative to its eventual dramatic conclusion.

The Afterlife Volumes will be player driven and interactive. Players will be able to report back the outcomes of battles and the tactical choices made during campaigns, and the information will be used to drive the next stage of the campaign or impact events in future Volumes.

The game will be skirmish level. The game play will be primarily statistics and D10 mechanics.

rpg: Go Fer Yer Gun! Roleplaying in the Wild West
148722.name: Saving Stetson City
rpgseries: Rusty Staple Games Western Modules Series (M)
148722.description:
from the introduction:
January 5th, 1868. Somewhere in Eldorado County, Arizona. Early on a quiet Sunday, you ride into Stetson City. The faithful folk of the
town are at worship – and most other sorts of folk are probably sleeping off last night’s revelries. Suddenly, the silence is broken sharply as shots ring out from the other side of town. You gallop in that direction, but arrive only in time to see a dust cloud fading in the distance -- riders heading for the hills. Later, trembling townsfolk tell you that Hoover’s Liquor Store was robbed; only the latest in a string of crimes plaguing Stetson City since Sheriff McCade was slain, two months ago. A Committee of Concerned Citizens (CCC) has been formed, but they are no match for hardened criminals, and the situation has reached a dire state. The CCC seeks your help in reclaiming the town, bringing it back from its lawless state. Is the mayhem just the random work of rowdies and bandits, or is there a coordinating intelligence behind some of the criminal activities? There are some decent, brave men in Stetson City -- men that you should be able to convince to join you as hired guns -- but they need leaders. That is where you come in.

Saving Stetson City is a Wild West Campaign Setting developed for use with the Go Fer Yer Gun Game!

rpg: Go Fer Yer Gun! Roleplaying in the Wild West
148723.name: Five Vignettes for Wild West Roleplaying
rpgseries: Rusty Staple Games Western Modules Series (M)
148723.description:
from the introduction:
These five ready-to-run Wild West roleplaying scenarios are for a small party of relatively low level but somewhat experienced PCs. The vignettes are first stated using the Go Fer Yer Gun! (GFYG!) system and then in terms of the Shotguns & Saddles (S&S) game. The scenarios can be played as stand-alone, self-contained, one-shot sessions or plugged into most any Wild West campaign. A few allusions are made to the setting of Rusty Staple Games’ Module M1, Saving Stetson City, but not in any essential way.

148724.name: Boot Hill (2nd Ed.) Statistics for “Five Vignettes for Wild West Roleplaying”
rpgseries: Rusty Staple Games Western Modules Series (M)
148724.description:
Subtitle:
Supplement to Rusty Staple Games Module M3

User comment:
A free supplement to Rusty Staple Games Module M3: Five Vignettes for Wild West Roleplaying, presenting statistics to adapt it for play using the Boot Hill (2nd Edition) rules.

148725.name: Table Pack 4: Creature from the Black Lagoon and Black Knight
148725.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Creature from the Black Lagoon was released in 1992 by Bally. It is based on an evening at the drive-in watching the classic Universal monster-movie. However you end up having to protect your date from the Creature! The bed of the table has a hologram of the Creature, the first pinball table to include such a feature.

Black Knight was released in 1980 by Williams, and was the first to introduce a split-level table. The game has a medieval theme where the player is fighting against the titular Black Knight.

148726.name: Table Pack 5: Harley Davidson and Taxi
148726.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Harley Davidson was released in 1999 by Stern, and is based on the famous motorcycle brand. The table includes a model of a Harley, which does a wheelie, revealing a ball lock. There are many multi-ball modes on this table. The overall aim of the table is to take a cross-country road-trip, visiting 16 cities along the way.

Taxi was released in 1988 by Williams. The player is a Taxi driver and the main aim of the game is to pick up five bizarre characters, including Mikhail Gorbachev, Dracula, and even Santa! The characters are picked up when lit by completing various objectives or hitting certain targets. Only two characters are available to be picked up initially, with others becoming available as you complete other tasks.

148727.name: The Gatling Decision (Savage Worlds edition)
148727.description:
from the introduction:
This adventure is designed for 4 novice player characters. 4 pre rolled characters are provided at the end of the adventure.

It is placed in the Wild West in Texas around the year 1881. It is a pulp adventure and doesn’t try to simulate realism. The village of Privilegio is totally fictitious.

User summary:
The characters impress a saloon owner after a bar-brawl (!) and are hired for a simple delivery job, but all is not as it seems.

148728.name: Teleglitch
148728.description:
User Summary

Teleglitch is a roguelike top-down shooter with pixel graphics. The game takes place in procedurally generated military research & training complex that has a different map every time you play.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
148729.description:
Engage the Nazi occupation of France in la petite guerre to throw off the yoke of the oppressors and free your homeland!

Maquis is a solitaire worker-placement game with variable goals and a play time of approximately twenty minutes. The player places his resistance agents on spaces around town to achieve his goals - blowing up trains, publishing underground newspapers - but at the same time Milice collaborators and Wehrmacht soldiers patrol the area. Agents who can't make it back to the safe house at the end of the day are arrested, and never seen again.
148729.name: Maquis
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P  077 - PnP Roundtable and Maquis
HLG 8: Gelukzoekers

148730.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In celebration of our tenth anniversary as a games publisher, this year we present an exclusive new game: COPA, which comes packaged in an elegant white box that contains nothing more than wood shells and beans — and a firework of ideas for games from four different classic game disciplines: strategy, memory, skill and bluff. You won't believe the amazing things you can do with cups and beans!
148730.name: Copa

148731.name: Snapps
148731.description:
A dexterity game for 2 or more players.
Plays in 10 minutes with 6 players.
For ages 6 and up .

In Snapps there are 6 blocks and a 8cm×8cm square board and all you have to do is place the blocks onto the board… simple.
Well, yes and no: You see, the blocks have magnets in them, and you must place the blocks without making any of them snap together. The first few blocks will be easy to place but as more blocks get placed, the available space on the board dwindles, and it becomes rather tricky to place the last blocks.

If all the blocks get placed on the board, the game enters a second phase, in which players must take turns to push a block towards the centre of the board. At some point the blocks will suddenly snap together, and the player taking their turn at the time is eliminated. Eliminate all your opponents to win.

Knowledge about the physics of magnetism is not essential; what you need are a steady hand and nerves of steel, because those snapping blocks will make you jump.

Schnapps is the adult variant, in which the player who makes the blocks snap together must drink a shot.

148732.name: Hole of DOOM!!!
148732.description:
Hole of DOOM!!! is akin to Battling Tops in that players spin tops on a wooden board, trying to push the opponent into the dreaded hole of DOOM! For 2-4 players.

From the Cubiko website....

In late 2012, whilst playtesting 'Clockwise' eight year old Samuel continued his annoying habit of spinning the games delicately designed cog mechanism.

"Samuel stop it! Turn the cogs gently, don't spin them." I pleaded.

Now Samuel is a great playtester and since he seemed obsessed with his spinning discovery, and wasn't about to stop any time soon, I decided it was best to follow his lead.

So there we were spinning the cog mechanism harder and faster when suddenly the smallest cog jumped from its hole and spun by itself. Well that was it, Samuel completely dismantled the wooded mechanism and began spinning each cog individually. Biting my lip, I reluctantly joined in and a game which resembled the classic 'Battling Tops' ensued.

I gradually warmed to the abuse of my cogs, however, our makeshift board was littered with 5mm holes and the spinning cogs would fall as they cross them. Samuel thought this was great and he called them holes of DOOM!

148733.name: Cubbage
148733.description: A dice game based upon the card game Cribbage. A player uses 13 dice to make pairs, straights or find dice that add up to 7. The game was designed for the 2013 Solitaire Contest, and can be played by 1 or 2 people.

148739.name: Serpent's Kiss
148739.description:
From the front page of the PDF:

Deep within the Neverwinter Wood, the embers of an ancient empire rekindle. Conspiracies lie behind every tree, and shadows blur the distinction between friend and foe. Caught between vying powers, a woman stands trial for the murder of her friends. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Neverwinter for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10).

This adventure is the second part of the Devil's Play Major Quest. This series of adventures (which begins with NEVE5-1 and concludes with NEVE5-3) is best experienced in order.

148740.description:
In Scotland Yard Master — a new version of the 1983 Spiel des Jahres-winning Scotland Yard — one of the players takes on the role of Mr. X. His job is to move from point to point around the map of London by taking taxis, buses or subways. The detectives – that is, the remaining players acting in concert – move around similarly in an effort to move into the same space as Mr. X and capture him. The tricky part is that while the criminal's mode of transportation is nearly always known, his exact location is known only intermittently throughout the game.

Scotland Yard Master includes six additional game elements, four of which are part of a free app for iOS and Android that offers detectives limited tools to locate Mr. X. For example, the detectives can use radio towers to get a rough sense of where Mr. X is located, with the color of the radio waves hinting at whether he's close to each tower. The two-dimensional game board can also be converted to a 3D view, and the detectives can ask witnesses on the buildings whether they've recently seen Mr. X. The app also allows for pass-and-play, with Mr. X having a self-generated PIN so that the detectives can't accidentally discover his location.

Scotland Yard Master also has new action options for Mr. X: "Helicopter" and "Sabotage".
148740.name: Scotland Yard Master

148742.name: Pro & Contra
148742.description:
Aim of the game
Players have to make others guess words by giving positive and negative statements about the term in question and without mentioning that word. By doing so, they practice argumentation skills and looking at something from different angles.
Game play
The game can either be played in teams (4 or more players) or everyone against everyone else (up to 5 players). The stack of cards is placed face-down next to the board. Each of the cards has a word on it (e.g. "talk shows", "mobile phone apps", "EU enlargement"). The starting player starts by giving a positive statement about the word on his/her card. If a player guesses correctly, both the player who explained and the one who guessed move 6 spaces on the board. If the word isn't guessed, the same player has to use a negative statement next round, and if successful both players get to move 5 spaces (one space less per round that it takes to explain the word). The player whose token reaches the finish line first wins the game.

148743.name: Maya: El Florado
148743.description:
A "Maya the bee" themed memory and dexterity game for children.

Theme
A thunderstorm is coming! Maya the bee and her friends are trying to bring home as much honey as possible before it gets too wet. Who'll manage to collect the most honey?

Aim of the game
Collect the most honey by remembering where the honey is and by skillfully throwing your token in the right places.

Setup
The 32 square meadow tiles (4 water lilies, 6 honey flowers, 22 dandelions) are shuffled and placed face down in the middle of the table. They form the meadow.
The player tokens (Maya, Willie, Flip, Beatrix) are placed at the edge of the meadow.

Game play
Players take turns throwing their player token on the meadow tiles. If your token lands on one or more meadow tiles, you place the tile face-up next to the meadow (if it is a water lily), place it face-up in front of you (dandelion) or place it face-up in front of you and get to look at two of the face-down meadow tiles and place them in a spot of your choice in the meadow (honey flower). If your token lands on another player's token, you have to give him/her one of the tiles you've collected.
When a player turns over the fourth water lily, he/she finishes the turn, and then the game ends. The player with the most flower tiles wins the game.

boardgameintegration: Times Square
Times Square
148744.description:
City of Zombies is a co-operative, dice-based intense team survival game. Players combine dice to target and remove zombies from an ever-advancing horde before their barricade is overrun.

The game is suitable for all ages and abilities, and can be played in as little as 15 minutes (in the shorter version). The key game mechanics involve manipulating the numbers rolled on the dice via combinations of mathematical functions (from basic addition and subtraction through to squaring and cube rooting) to hit the exact numbers on the encroaching zombie cards - you need a precise head shot to take them out! As a co-op game, the difficulty can be tailored to suit the skills of the players, and supports groups of mixed abilities well.

Originally developed to assist the designer's daughter with her maths, the game has fantastic learning potential for players. It offers number manipulation skills by stealth rather than in a more traditional overtly "educational" game setting. What was designed with educational intent has become a great game for gamers and their families, and suits more experienced groups as a good warm-up or end of night filler.
148744.name: City of Zombies

148745.description:
We Were Brothers is the ultimate WWII infantry warfare board game and the first cross-over wargame. The game covers thirty historical missions for U.S., Wehrmacht, British and Italian armies from the three landings theaters in Italy: Operation Husky, Operation Avalanche and Operation Shingle.

We Were Brothers is a cross-over wargame because it effectively blends elements from several game categories. From the wargame it shares historical, technical and tactical accuracy. Every wargamer, from the newbie to the expert one, will be delighted with the level of detail and all the classic elements as LOS, covers, scattering, different weapons, roles, suppressive fire, opportunity fire, off-board artillery support and Clos Air Support, etc. However, the original lean game mechanics Alea Struggle System allows does not use any table, ruler or other complicate measurement method, making the game fast, deep and easy to learn, yet challenging to master.

Between each scenario the random mission generator allows recreating your own historically accurate scenarios in order to complete your personal day-by-day race to Rome: you can generate your soldiers and squad, each one with his own skills and background, put them into battle and see how they evolve in terms of skills as they survive from mission to mission.

The miniatures inside the box and the whole game system is in 1:72 scale. In this way, any add-on to the game in terms of sceneries, vehicles, miniatures and props can be easily purchased by any model store, such as at www.wbsgames.com

Each player leads a team of four men, including one specialist, and fights against the opponent, in cooperation with other teams to form a Squad. The Combat and movement system is very lean since you don't need rulers, tables, charts as the usual wargames, yet it is very historically, technically and physically accurate to be enjoyed by hardcore wargamers. For its mechanisms, the game concentrates on suppression fire/moving and cover to cover maneuvers, simulating the real WWII tactics as well as assaulting impulse.

We Were Brothers is a game system that will be enriched by the Armoured Combat expansion and other operation theaters.
148745.name: We Were Brothers

148747.name: Sancak Beyi
148747.description:
Collectible Card Game about Anatolian History and Mythology. New game mechanics are adding new excitement to your game experience.

Sancak Beyi is a card game for two players.

Both players begin the game with the title Sancak Beyi. The General purpose is to complete the two Tuğ of the Flags before the opponent and to win the game with the title "Beyler Beyi". During this process, to avoid the opponent to complete

The game is played with specially prepared 60 cards for each player on a special prepared game area. When starting the game both player has to shuffle their card decks and pick up 9 cards from the top of the deck. The players have to agree who begins the game.

There must be 2 Tuğ cards, minimum 4, maximum 5 Cengaver cards, minimum 6, maximum 20 Asker cards. The rest of the deck may include depending on the players choice, any numbers of Ganimet, Olgu and Bilgelik cards.

148748.name: Envoyer (Issue 113 - Mar 2006)
rpg: It Came from the Late, Late, Late Show (1st, 2nd & 3rd edition)
148748.description:
User summary
Monster Mania - two short monstrous modules (for Shadowrun and Warhammer Fantasy) and a longer on (for the Late, Late Show), plus some MMORPG monsters for offline use - these form the core of the present issue. Several articles (e.g. the second part of the article on the Deutscher Rollenspiele-Preis DRSP 2005), an interview with Ulrike Pelchen and reviews round it off.

148750.name: Fleet: Kickstarter Box
boardgameaccessory: Fleet
Fleet: Arctic Bounty
148750.description:
During the Kickstarter campaign for Fleet: Arctic Bounty, this was offered as one of the add-ons.

This box is able to hold both Fleet and Fleet: Arctic Bounty, all KS-only, BGG Store and other promos, fish cubes or meeples and more.

Source: Kickstarter page for Fleet: Arctic Bounty.

148751.name: Joining Hands 2
148751.description:
A charming sequel to the handtastic puzzle game hit Joining Hands!

On a starry night, the adorable little Peablins are woken up by a blazing ball of fire crashing into the far corner of Whispering Woods. What could it be? Join the Peablins, solve sweet puzzles and find out!

Joining Hands 2 is intuitive and easy to play; drag and drop the Peablins so that everyone is holding hands. The level of challenge increases as the Peablins get more hands and new types of Peablins are introduced. Try to collect all the stars from each level too!

The original Joining Hands is featured in the book ”iPad Apps for Kids for Dummies” as an excellent family friendly title!

Features

More than 140 fun and challenging levels
Eight kinds of adorable Peablin characters
Unlimited hint system: Never get stuck
Fun for all ages: No violence, no time limits, no pressure
Great for child and parent cooperative puzzling
Cute graphics and joyful soundtrack
Ten achievements

Source: The Game Website.

148752.name: Unholy Heights
148752.description:
User Summary

This is a mash-up of apartment simulation with tower defense. Attract "monster" tenants to your apartment, collect their rent money, furnish their apartments with what they want to make them happy. When the humans come a-calling have the monsters defend their lair.

148753.name: Enough Plumbers 2
148753.description:
Create clones and utilise their special abilities all whilst controlling them simultaneously in this crazy puzzle-platformer.

Source: The Game Website.

148754.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 144 - Aug 1987)
148754.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #144
August 1987

Cover art by Scott Ruggels.

148756.name: Cope
148756.description:
In Cope each player controls four members of a family who each start the game at a different stage of life (child, teen, adult, senior citizen), or "growth level" as the game has it.

Each growth level is represented by a track which is moved around by die roll. Various spaces on the tracks will require players to draw Good News or Bad News cards. Others will allow the player to try the "Ladder of Life" by coping with a crisis or opportunity. Coping is performed by rolling a large dodecahedron; the result may let the family member cope with the problem and advance, or it may require help from a family member at another growth level, in which case that member has to be moved.

Family members may get "promoted" to later growth levels. The levels are designated by plastic rings of different colors placed on the pieces.

The object of the game is to get all of your family members home first, but the real objective of the game is educational. As the introduction to the rules say, "the purpose of the game is to teach individual and family participation on how to COPE with daily situations in life."

148757.name: Shotzee: The Numbers Game
148757.description:
In Shotzee each player has a score sheet with four 3x3 grids. On a turn, a player rolls from 1-4 dice (their choice) and then all players must enter the number rolled in an empty space in one of their grids.

After all the grids are full they are scored. Players score for columns in which the first two numbers add up to the third, rows in which the second number subtracted from the first equals the third, and long diagonals in which the first two numbers multiplied together equal the third.

Bonus points are given for combinations where the result (third number) is particularly high, for having multiple additions or subtractions score in one grid, and for "Shotzees," which are multiplications where the result is 21.

As a variant, on each die roll each player must write the number in one box in each of their grids.

148758.description:
Thunder Gods: Kamikazes at Okinawa portrays the massive Kikusui offensive by waves of hundreds of suicide attacks against the Allied invasion fleet off of Okinawa. The game is composed of three mini-games, one on the US destroyer “picket line”, another on the carrier fleet, and a third on the invasion support fleet, that can be played separately or combined. Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their aircraft and ships’ Anti-aircraft batteries as well as resolve combats.

Rules include Operation Ten Go, the Japanese fleet’s final mission of the battleship Yamato and her escorts in a one-way sortie to attack the American invasion fleet, Kaityn suicide submarine attacks, as well as variable deployments of ships and CAP (combat air patrol). Each copy of Thunder Gods has three maps, 51 double-sided, un-mounted counters, 5 pages of rules, and 4 pages of historical commentary and bibliography. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh with graphics by Bruce Yearian.

Part 1 of the game was originally published in issue #5 of Panzer Digest. This edition features the other two unpublished modules/games, new graphics by Bruce Yearian, linking "campaign game" rules and 4 pages of historical commentary/designer notes.
148758.name: Thunder Gods: Kamikazes Over Okinawa (Second Edition)

148759.description:
Time Masters is a fast paced deck building card game for 2 to 4 players that takes 30-45 minutes.

Only powerful mages who have dedicated their existence to the knowledge of time and the ways of bending it to their will may enter the Time Master’s tournament. To do this, they must master “Kè’s” – small portions of day-time necessary for their concentration.

Each player will embody one of these mages. They will need to carefully select and cast their spells in order to accumulate as much knowledge as possible before the end of the tournament to be declared the most powerful mage. Who knows, maybe even before it has even started !

Very similar to handling “Mana” in other games, you start with 4 active Kè that you will replenish by playing special concentration cards. With special cards called Timers you will prepare powerful combinations by keeping a card aside to be used on your next round to beat your opponents.

Time Masters – Highlights :

Deck building style offering a large freedom to the player to build his combos
Victory points are on the playing cards and are not bought separately (like in Dominion)
Cards which are “bought” during a player’s turn go straight to their hand and not their discard pile; these cards can be played directly on the next turn.
More than 30% of spell cards drive interactions between players
Resource management; your mana (Ke’s) is handled on the table independently from your spells thus not polluting your hand.
148759.name: Time Masters

148762.name: Buzzed Out!
148762.description:
A great game to get the party started. Riotous fun designed to bring out your competitive side. Try to guess correctly, the word or common phrase of your team mate in this manic quick fire game. Game contents include word cards and an electronic timer. Don't get caught in possession!
Preperation for the game:
-Split into two teams.
-Decide how many points a team needs to score to win the game. We recommend 8.
-Choose which coloured side of the cards you will play for your game.
-Shuffle the deck of cards and place down in the centre of the table.

Playing the game:
-One player is nominated from each team to be the describing player for the first round, the remaining players on the team are the guessing players.
-Once you have selected your describing and guessing players a member of either team can activate the timer.
-Once the timer is activated the timer ticks for an undisclosed amount of time.During this time the describing player of Team One collects a card from the top of the card pile. Each card features 10 items of phrases. The describing player selects any one of the ten and describes their selection to the guessing members on their team. The description can only be made by voice , no gestures are allowed. The describing player must not use any part of the word or phrase to help their description. The guessing players do their best to answer as quickly as possible.
- On correctly guessing the item or phrase the card is passed to Team Two's describing player who then selects a different item or phrase from the same list of ten. They then proceed to describe the selected item to their guessing players. Again, on a correct guess the card is passed back to Team One's Describing player, who picks a new item or phrase. This process continues with both teams attempting to describe and guess correctly as quickly as possible so they may return the card to the opposing team.
-During this time the timer continues to tick until eventually a buzzer sounds marking the end of the round. Whichever team is left holding the card is the loser!

Tips and points to remember:
1) You cannot predict when the buzzer will sound because this changes each time you play a round.
2) Once a team have guessed an item or phrase correctly the card is deemed to be in play with the other team. Unnecessary delays in handing over the card or taking the card are not allowed. Persistent offenders should be penalised by losing a point.
3) Teams must pay attention so as not to repeat the description of an item or phrase already featured in that round. Repeating words only wastes time for your team!

Scoring:
-The losing team in a round fails to score, however, the winning team scores 1 point.
-should the teams manage to guess all ten items and phrases on the card correctly before the buzzer sounds both teams score 1 point.
-For round two change your describing and guessing players.

Winning the game:
The first team to the agreed number of points is the winner!

Good Luck!

148763.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 147 - Nov 1987)
148763.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #147
November 1987

Cover art by John Kingsbury.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Children's Game Winner
148764.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Fire Dragon Valley, it's bubbling dangerously underground. After a thousand years, the mighty volcano Rubino is once again on the brink of an eruption! The dragon riders can hardly wait, as according to an old legend, precious dragon rubies will burst out of the Rubino. The saying goes that whoever feeds his fire dragon with these rubies will make him invincible!

In Feuerdrachen, the players become dragon riders and set off for Rubino! They have to move their figures with tactical skill — and a bit of luck with the dice — around the volcano to try to collect the precious dragon rubies. In the end whoever has collected the most rubies in their little bag wins.
148764.name: Feuerdrachen

148765.name: Trubel auf dem Bauernhof
148765.description:
Game description from the publisher:

A new animal has come to Farmer Ben's farm — Sparky, the little dog. He immediately starts investigating his new surroundings. Which animals still live on the farm? In Trubel auf dem Bauernhof, players accompany Paulchen as he goes to see the different farmyard animals and listen as they welcome him loudly!

This collection of games offers plenty of variety in the form of a cooperative dice game, fun sound memory game, lightning-fast reaction game, and two story games.

148766.name: Maus van Klecks
148766.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Little Mouse van Klecks is a world-renowned artist. She has invited her best friends to come over to her studio today to paint with her. Each one of them enthusiastically grabs a paintbrush, paint colors and a canvas and is ready to go! But what's this? The small mouse's artist's palettes are tiny and can hold only three paint colors! How are you going to paint a car this way? Or a house? What about a butterfly?

During each round in Maus van Klecks, the players each secretly pick three colors and dab them on their palettes. The palettes are then compared at the end of the round. For every matching color, the animal artists receive a small tasty tart as their reward. The first player to collect three small cake slices wins.

148767.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Want to be as strong, brave and glorious as the knight Brandon the Brave? To become a knight, all knaves first have to master regal tasks and prove that they have good intuition. Your task is to seek out giants, dragons, witches, and other dangers!

In Brandon the Brave, the player who can skillfully place the field tiles next to one another, thus mastering the tasks, will be the lustrous champion at the end of the game.
148767.name: Brandon the Brave
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 28!!!

148768.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Emil's huge elephant stomach is grumbling, so he's going to the supermarket to get some food. At the store, he piles up his shopping cart with one delicious treat after another — but cheeky mice are trying to scare Emil to make his tower of treats fall. In Oh Schreck, der Speck fliegt weg!, the players can help Emil and win only if they have courage, skill and a steady hand.
148768.name: Oh Schreck, der Speck fliegt weg!

148769.name: Großer Spielezauber
148769.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Who will be thrilled to enter this big wonderland of games? In Großer Spielezauber, both very small ones and their parents will find ten different games with easy rules and a short playing time, such as a picture bingo, color die game, memory game, domino, stacking game, look-closely game, and many more. Their gradually increasing degree of difficulty and the caringly designed game material will provide long lasting play fun.

148770.name: Mimis Kullerspaß
148770.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Wow, there are so many things going on here! Today Mimi Mouse is playing with cheese, corn and nuts in the larder. She always has so many fabulous ideas. Be it a memory or die game, the game collection Mimis Kullerspaß — with construction elements of My First Ball Track Sets — offers a lot of diversity. Hence the very smallest can already have ball-rolling fun and become acquainted with first game rules.

148771.name: Wo sind Zebra, Löwe & Co?
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series
148771.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The two cheeky friends Zack Zebra and Luisa Lion are thinking up many funny game ideas for their zoo friends. Who wants to join in?

Be it a memory game, a competition or a look-closely game, the game collection Wo sind Zebra, Löwe & Co? offers to all small animal fans a variety of fun games with simple rules and a short play duration. With this collection, children enter the world of zoo animals and, as they do so, learn fine motor skills, concentration, close observation and a basic understanding of rules. Plus, they can play independently with the wooden figures until their heart's content.

148772.name: Lilli's Favorite Clothes
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series
148772.description:
Game description from the publisher:

What do Lilli and her friends want to wear today? Be it a skirt or short trousers, blouse or shirt, sneakers or ballet flats, inside Lilli's wardrobe are the most amazing clothes. But where are the stripy socks again? In the drawer or in the wardrobe? Whoever memorizes well the location of the tiles and has some luck in Lilli's Favorite Clothes will be able to dress her girl first.

148773.name: Midnight Vigil
148773.description:
from the introduction:
Midnight Vigil is an experimental roleplaying story game where players recall the life of someone they’ve lost. The game is played in character and is not an attempt to replicate an actual vigil for real people. It is played over the course of one hour and each person takes on the role of someone at a candlelight
vigil remembering someone special. It can be exceptionally useful for writing backgrounds for characters or give players a chance to explore villains they have just slain.

148774.name: Drop
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
148774.description:
from the introduction:
In DROP, you and your friends will write a story. To keep this story from devolving into silliness too quickly, its plot is carefully structured.

You will write a story in five parts: a preparation phase where you discuss the basic parameters of the story, and four story acts. Each player will control one crewmember on a starship that’s been summoned to a planet. The crew will descend to the planet’s surface, explore a mysterious landmark, then run for their lives.

You can also play this game yourself, by taking on all the characters’ roles. The game assumes that the players are friends, and that they will freely discuss the ongoing story among themselves. This is not a competitive game, though you can screw over the other players.

user summary:
Drop is a semi-freeform story game in which the players take on the roles of explorers descending to the surface of a planet and encountering a nameless horror.

148775.name: The Green Game
148775.description:
The Green Game is an entertaining, enlightening and sometimes alarming way to examine the ecological facts and myths that face us today.

The person who bought the game always goes first. Players roll the die and move their tokens around the circular track. Landing on certain spaces lets the player answer a question. Correct answers reduce the player's carbon footprint, while incorrect answers increase the carbon footprint. Other spaces have players draw "Eco-Warrior" cards that reduce the carbon footprints, or "Eco-Pig" cards that increase the carbon footprint. The first player to reach the smallest carbon footprint on the scoring board (8 points) wins the game.

The Green Game is made from recycled material, soy inks and wooden game pieces.

148776.name: Cookie Jar
148776.description:
from the Overview:
In COOKIE JAR, the players take turns accusing one another of a CRIME until the actual culprit is revealed. The crime can be anything from stealing a pie to vandalizing a school. However, murder is always the perfect ingredient for truly dramatic stories and will be used for every example below.

148777.name: Dogfight D6's: An Aerial Combat, Dice Rolling Game
148777.description:
Take to the skies in a tabletop dogfight! Players take turns rolling dice to soar across the board, attempting to shoot down their opponent's planes while using evasive maneuvers or returning fire. With 12 2-sided, shiftable sky panels that make up the game board, an Event deck that alters battlefield conditions, and the option of choosing to play as 1 of 8 unique pilots instead of a basic ship, no 2 Dogfight games will be the same!

About Dogfight D6's: Whatever version, Dogfight D6's is a dice rolling, aerial combat themed game which was designed to allow for competitive players while still providing appeal to gamers who prefer less wordy, "quick pick up and play" kinds of games. The objective remains the same for either audience (roll dice to move and shoot down planes), however, the rules are written to allow players of both audiences to participate in the same game and enjoy it without being imbalanced towards either one.

Features in this Version:


2 sided, interchangable playing field pieces- each has 1 "all blue spaces" side and 1 "cloud patterns" side, allowing for a different playing field each game!



Plane tokens for up to 8 players, although the rules are structured to allow for more players.



Pilot Cards and Custom Pilot Setup Rules- Now choose either the Basic Pilot Setup (all Stats are set at 2 with no abilities) or use these rules/cards to play a game with unique abilities and rolled Stats.



Event Cards-Cards which affect gameplay and battlefield conditions as long as they are active.

148779.name: Symbol Set 2: Fantasy Floorplans
148779.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Whether you are delving dungeons or fitting out inns, Symbol Set 2: Fantasy Floorplans will give an attractive new look to your campaign that will amaze your players. Fantasy Floorplans expands CC3 with over 2500 amazing new symbols in four distinctive styles.

Every new symbol is a mini-masterpiece, created by renowned artists. And although they took our experts thousands of hours to create, you can add them to your maps in seconds. So whatever your design skill, your floorplans can be stunning works of art. There are bitmap and vector, fantasy and hand-drawn styles of furnishings, fixtures, traps, treasure and sundry items - everything you need to design great floorplans. We give you 150 monsters and characters; ideal for counters and encounters.
The styles range from photo-realistic to handdrawn, making everything possible from high-detail battlemaps to beautiful player handouts. Whichever you use, they'll help you make impressive and exciting maps.

148780.name: Symbol Set 1: Fantasy Overland
148780.description:
Publisher Blurb:

CC3 maps look great, but you might want even more choice. Something to make your maps really stand out and your players really sit up. Welcome to Symbol Set 1: Fantasy Overland.

ProFantasy's Symbol Set 1, Fantasy Overland, adds four fabulous new symbol styles to CC3. There are more than 2,500 new symbols in SS1, each one painstakingly crafted by expert fantasy artists. And their pain is your benefit. A symbol that took hours to create can be added to a map in moments. With these new Fantasy Overland symbols you can make the most beautiful, distinctive CC3 maps yet.

You use these symbols exactly like any other CC3 Pro symbol - pick one from the onscreen symbol catalog and click to place it anywhere. Smart symbols help you create a natural, organic look, automatically adding slight random variation as you place them.

148782.name: AT-43 Unit Box: Star Troopers
148782.description:
The star troopers are the regular White Stars troops… Naturally anything regular in the armed forced of the U.N.A. would be extraordinary anywhere else. The star troopers training cycle is designed for the mass production of professional soldiers. The star troopers are gathered in large units whose efficiency is due to both the quality and the number of its soldiers.
The star troopers are the ideal complement to steel trooper units. They drown the enemy is a hailstorm of bullets with their assault rifle. And when the MG starts playing, the hailstorm becomes a hurricane.
For further tactical potential, one of the star troopers can be promoted Sergeant.

Contents:
• Box of 8 miniatures.
• 2 cards : Steel TacArm Sgt, Steel TacArm

148783.name: AT-43 Attachment Box: Wing Troopers
148783.description:
“Imagine yourself overlooking a battlefield from thirty five thousand kilometers above. Death from on high.”
– Wing troopers’ advertisement campaign, AT-42.

The Attachment Box: Wing Troopers contains all the miniatures necessary to strengthen a standard wing trooper unit: officers (ranking from sergeant to colonel), a medic and special weapon bearers (a laser gun, a missile launcher and two sniper guns).

The wing troopers form extremely fast and deadly units. They are the spearhead of the offensive. Their favorite strategy is to strike behind enemy lines, catching the enemy in a pincer movement, and fall back on a defensive position once it is done.

With an extended choice of special weapons and the addition of officers to their ranks, your wing troopers can now face any kind of threat. There are literally going fall upon the enemy!

Contents:
• Box of 6 miniatures + 6 alternative heads, 1 officer with assault rifle, combat knife, grenades. 1 missile launcher bearer. 1 Volcano MG bearer. 1 flamer bearer. 1 medic with assault rifle, combat knife & grenades. 1 field engineer with assault rifle, combat knife & grenades.
• 8 cards : Wing trooper officer x5, Wing trooper x3

148784.name: Ancient Battle: Rome
148784.description:
Designed from the ground up Ancient Battle: Rome gives a unique wargaming experience on iPhone and iPad. Use Roman legionaries, elephants, catapults, heavy and light cavalry, archers, slingers, fanatics and many other unit types to engage in classic battles.

Included in the initial release is 'Caesars campaign in Gaul' culminating in the classic siege of Alesia, and the campaign between Julius Caesar and Pompey the Great, including the battle of Pharsalus.

You can also purchase additional campaigns, of the invasion of Brittania with the highlight of Queen Boudicca's demise at the battle of Verulamum, and Germania with the Roman massacre at Teutoburger Wald.

Upcoming expansions include the infamous Parthia campaign where a whole Roman army perished in the desert and the Pontic campaign against Mithridates the Great. These later campaigns will also add fully armoured cataphracts, light and scythed chariots, light cavalry archers and the Greek Pike Phalanx to the game system.

Key Game Features:

● High Definition Ancient Era Graphics.
● 6 Mission Tutorial Campaign.
● 8 Mission Gallia Campaign playable as Roman and Gaul.
● 8 Mission Italia Campaign playable as Caesar and Pompey.
● 30 Unique Ancient Units.
● Detailed Combat Analysis
● Flank Attacks
● Hours of Gameplay.
● Game Center Achievements and Leaderboards.
● Universal App (Works on iPhone & iPad)
● Additional Purchasable Campaigns.

Purchasable Extra Content:

● 8 Mission Britannia Campaign playable as Romans and Britons.
● 8 Mission Germania Campaign playable as Romans and Germans.

Source: The Developer Website.

148785.description:
A long time ago, a little before the Middle Ages, flourished the kingdom of Abraxas. Queen Gourmandine IV ruled the kingdom of gastronomes with an iron fist in a velvet potholder. Each year, the greatest magicians of the known world competed to create new recipes as delectable as they could. It's now Midsummer, and the Abraxians are looking forward to that special tournament day when the most powerful magicians of the kingdom face off before everyone else gets to chown down!

In Magic Cooking, you take the role of one of these magicians and use the available ingredients the best way that you can. Whose cooking will reign supreme?
148785.name: Magic Cooking

148786.name: Anduin (Issue 72 - May 2002)
148786.description: An interstellar issue with articles about travel, love and NPCs in outer space, a system-neutral Star Wars adventure seed, scenarios for Fallout and Shadowrun, a location for DSA, some fiction, a comic and reviews.

148787.name: AT-43 Hero Box: Lieutenant Dragomira O-3
148787.description:
"Right away, Sir!" "But...I haven't given you any orders yet?!?" "No need. I know." - Lieutenant Dragomira O-3, before her first engagement.

Dragomira O-3 is an officer and a hero for the Red Blok army. She can become the officer of any Dragomirov kolossus unit. Lieutenant Dragomira O-3 is a monster of endurance that not only allows to increase the maximum number of fighters in her unit, but she also provides it with an excellent officer. Her "Gestalt" ability increases the leadership point pool of her company. The special rules for Dragomira O-3 are detailed in AT-43 Campaign: Frostbite. T

Contains:
1 miniature
1 card

148788.name: AT-43 Attachment Box: RPG Soldaty
148788.description:
“In the absence of orders, seek something worth shooting and destroy it.”
- Popular RPG soldaty instruction.

Here come the officers available to lead the RPG soldaty to victory. They lead their men with an iron hand and obtain such obedience from them that these officers are respected for their leadership skills throughout the universe.

To make sure nothing will ever stop your RPG soldat units, here are some extra special weapons and specialists. There will never be too many soldiers to defend the Revolution!

The box contains 6 miniatures plus the appropriate cards.

148789.name: Adjugé..!
148789.description:
Players acquire various objects at public auction. Each object is present three times: in good condition, in poor condition and a fake object. The goal is to capture as much works of art of great value, avoiding works in poor condition or even fake art.

In each round, the first player turns over a action card. If it shows an auction, the player takes the hammer of auctioneer and take the object card with the starting price 2000 francs. The best bid wins the card, then the purchaser discovers the condition of the object he just acquired!

Some action cards allows player to look at the condition of the object.

The goal is to acquire objects forming series - a series of three objects is double the amount of objects that compose it.
When all the object cards are sold, the player with the most valuable collection is the winner.

148790.name: Top! Totem
148790.description:
The board represents a grid map of 8 columns x 9 rows with a central zone comprising six central squares and a totem pole in the center!
Each player has 12 pawns and 3 riders. Each pawn moves one step forward or sideways, only the rider can go back. Riders are always moved after the pawns.
All pawns can take a shot at a time, unless the rider who can play two consecutively.
Only pawns can enter the central squares.
The first who eliminates all opposing checkers with at least one of his pawns in the sacred precincts wins a round and scores points. The first player to reach 300 points wins the game.

148791.name: GURPS Thaumatology: Ritual Path Magic
148791.description:
From the Publisher:

You Can Do Anything!

Magic is a creative force, and those who can harness its full potential can change the universe. This is the core of GURPS Thaumatology: Ritual Path Magic, a complete, stand-alone, and self-contained magic system for GURPS. Designed to emulate the magic of real-world traditions and popular books, movies, and television shows, this framework permits practitioners to cast improvised spells, elaborate rituals, and everything in between. This supplement empowers you to:


Master the traits necessary to become a Ritual Path magician, from specialized advantages to the core and Path skills behind every spell . . . or alter them to fit your campaign needs.
Learn how to craft rituals to produce the effect you want with the skills you have, and what can help or hinder you when gathering the energy to make the ritual work.
Acquaint yourself with the benefits and pitfalls of various methods for making spell-casting easier, including charms, elixirs, grimoires, places of power, enchanted items, and more.
Discover ways to modify the basic system, how to combine it with other magic systems, what awful things happen when you mess up a spell, and exactly what you cannot do with Ritual Path magic.
See how the system works with over 80 sample rituals that cover all the major effects the average caster relies on, such as healing, injury, communication, and protection.


With this system, you can augment the arcanists of the GURPS Monster Hunters series (or other modern-day magical myths), wend new ways for wizened wizards, and provide new possibilities to power for any setting. With GURPS Thaumatology: Ritual Path Magic, where there's a will, there's a way!

148793.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters
148793.description:
User Summary

Based on the television with the same name, this is the only game released for the Game Boy.

The player must defeat different characters to advance to the next stages.

148794.name: Geister der Vergangenheit (Private Eye)
148794.description:
publisher blurb

Geister der Vergangenheit
von Martin Lindner

Patrick Aylewood ist tot: Mit einem gezielten Kopfschuss von dem vor Wut rasenden Vater seiner Ex-Verlobten erschossen. Die Vertreter des Gesetzes gehen schnell zur Tagesordnung über, zu eindeutig scheint die Beweislage. Und so wartet der Leichnam des Firmenerbes aufgebahrt in einem düsteren Zimmerchen auf die Beisetzung, während der Mörder in seiner Zelle schmort.
Doch seine Tat hat auch für die Tochter und verhinderte Braut dramatische Folgen. Ist denn wirklich alles so klar, wie es scheint? Die junge Frau will Antworten und beauftragt die Detektive, ihr welche zu liefern.
Die Suche führt diese in das Liddesdale am Liddel Water in der Grenzregion zwischen England und Schottland. Eine scheinbar rückständige Gegend mit etwas Industrie und gleichzeitig romantisch verklärt im Zuge der wachsenden Schottlandbegeisterung. Das Land ist zudem reich an Geistern: in den Köpfen und vielleicht sogar echten, Zeugen einer langen kriegerischen Vergangenheit. Da ist es keine leichte Aufgabe, hinter den verschlossen wirkenden Mienen der Schotten nach einer wie immer gearteten Wahrheit zu suchen. Vielleicht aber offenbaren sich die Geister der Vergangenheit ja doch. Wer weiß, was sich im Dunkel der Zeiten und Herzen verbirgt ...

translation from Google
Ghosts of the Past
Martin Lindner

Patrick Aylewood is dead : Shot with a targeted head shot of the raging fury of his father, ex-fiancee . The representative of the law quickly go over the agenda , the evidence seems to be clear . And so the body of the company is waiting heritage laid out in a dark little room at the funeral , while the murderer stews in his cell.
But his act has dramatic consequences for the bride 's daughter and prevented . Is it really all so clear as it seems ? The young woman wants answers and asked the detectives to give her some .
The search leads them into the Liddel water in Liddesdale on the border region between England and Scotland . A seemingly backward area with little industry while romantically transfigured in the light of the growing Scotland enthusiasm . The country is also rich in spirits : in the minds and perhaps even genuine witnesses of a long military history. Since it is not an easy task to look behind the closed acting faces of the Scots after a truth whatsoever . Perhaps , however, the ghosts of the past reveal anyway . Who knows what is hidden in the mists of time and heart ...

148796.name: Metal Dungeon
148796.description:
From the Box:

Five character types to choose from: Fencer, Striker, Analyzer, Caster and Broader.

Ten huge dungeon levels to explore and conquer.

Randomly generating dungeons, so you never play the same level twice.

Totally customizable advancement system lets you build characters any way you choose.

Use chips and implants to enhance your cyborgs by adding spells, abilities and equipment.

Create and swap your powerful group of adventurers, and discover new bodies to revive in the grounds below.

148797.name: Tongbrekers
148797.description: Tongbrekers (a.k.a. "Tongue Twisters") is a Dutch game in which players draw cards (from a deck of 51 cards), then attempt to correctly utter the tongue twister on that card three times in a row at an ever faster speed. If they succeed, they get to keep the card, which can be used to complete sets of cards for extra points. In addition to the 48 regular cards — which come in eight colors, with two cards in each of three degrees of difficulty — the game includes three special cards that allow a player to attempt to steal a card from someone else. The game ends once all cards have been drawn, and the player with the most points wins.

148798.name: Double Pack: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: Legend / Anniversary
148798.description:
From the Back of the Box:

Lara Croft is Back!

148799.name: Dark Mortals
148799.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rogue Mage Creatures of Darkness Vol 5: Dark Mortals brings you a selection of new foes born of humanity's corruptible nature.

Beneath the minor powers in the infernal hierarchy are corrupted mortals and their hellhole-bred offspring. They are the foot soldiers of the armies of Darkness, and the infernal powers are always seeking to expand their ranks in preparation for future battles.

Includes:

Dark Human are twisted humans born of the hellholes and possessed by evil at birth.
Dark Mule result when a Dark Mage and human, these elite warriors of Darkness result.
Blackheart, sample dark mule
Dark Mage is what results when a neomage gives themselves over to the Darkness.
Pietra Soul-Drowner, sample dark neomage
Daywalkers are the mixed offspring of entities of both Light and Darkness bestow abilities of a dual nature, making them ideal covert operatives.
A Blood Succubus is the result of a succubus queen who feeds upon a seraph-blooded mortal to feed her unborn brood.
Nightwalkers arise when a mortal willingly feasting upon the blood of certain Dark creatures, transforming them into an accursed immortal.




Rogue Mage Creatures of Darkness Vol 5: Dark Mortals details a number of new, mortal-based enemies to use in your game, and is the fifth such creature PDF released by Christina Stiles through Misfit Studios.

148800.name: Dragons
148800.description:
From publisher blurb:

Opposing the seraphim are the powers of the Darkness, former servants of the Most High who rebelled against his rule, as depicted in Christian Scripture and apocrypha. After their defeat they were cast into Hell. Over the eons since then other servants of the Most High fell from grace, bolstering their infernal ranks.

Dragons are former major seraphs who participated in the original Fall, defying the Most High and creating war in Heaven. They are the power behind all the Darkness, both literally and figuratively. Even chained and imprisoned in the depths of the Earth, they command their followers, working to free themselves at any cost.

Rogue Mage Creatures of Darkness Vol 4: Dragons details a general dragon, and provides specific information on the dragons Azazel (the Aqua Dragon) and Semjaza (the Black Dragon).

148802.name: Path of Pirates
148802.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the fourth installment of our Adventure Path Iconics line, and the eight characters herein are specifically designed for play in a pirate-themed Adventure Path. Each character has a full stat block, including campaign traits, a detailed background and personality, and advice on advancement through 4th level. Find one that suits you and you’re ready to play. These characters have been built using a 20-point buy, as many Pathfinder players and GMs prefer it. However, each comes with instructions on how to adjust the stats to a 15-point buy, should your GM wish to use the standard for Paizo’s adventure paths. If your group enjoys an epic fantasy feel for their characters, then adjustments up to a 25-point buy are also available. Whatever your style of play, just a few minor tweaks will have you ready to go.

The iconic consist of four human characters and four unique races from the NeoExodus: A House Divided campaign setting such as:

Dalrean: Dalrean are a race of sentient, mobile plants. If a treant is a thinking tree, a dalrean is a thinking flower, and indeed, the spellcasters of this race are noted for their astonishing floral ‘spellbuds.’ Dalrean, who live exceedingly long lives, are closely tied to the natural cycles of Exodus.
Enuka: The most primal and barbaric of the savage humanoids have nothing on the Enukas. Enukas are ferocious creatures of the wild lands, animalistic predators blessed with humanoid form an intelligence. This combination has not softened their instincts for battle and the hunt, but it has given them a fatalistic warrior culture well suited to their savage natures.
Prymidian: Prymidians are regal, red-skinned humanoids. Their stately demeanor and formidable build impress other races and their learning follows suit. The prymidians are a communication and language-inclined race, dedicated to scientific reason, research, expansion of knowledge and discovery. Their culture seeks to know all there is to know in Exodus, and to communicate that knowledge to others. None know better than the prymidians that knowledge truly is power.
Sasori: Resources wax and wane, weapons and spells become obsolete, the master craftsman of one era is displaced by the industry of the next, and even land becomes worthless with the shifting ages - information, say the Sasori, is the one commodity that is always in demand. These scorpion-like creatures are brokers of information, by turns the greatest secret-keepers and the supreme spies of Exodus. Sasori are also known for their willingness - and ability - to kill to protect their secrets.




These iconic consist of:

Bale Tehya, Male prymidian bard (sea singer)
Bilgeghost, Female sasori monk
Flowing Kelp, Male dalrean sorcerer
Shark-Stalker, Male enuka barbarian
Trista Rask, Female human gunslinger
Sabine Finn, Female human druid of the God of Storms and Seas (shark shaman)
Ral Fayden, Human ranger (freebooter)
Salty Jake, Male human rogue (poisoner)

148803.name: Forester
148803.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysterious Woodland Protectors

With the Forester, a new 10-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games) your elf won't have to rely on magic. As rugged and wild bowmen they'll be able to handle whatever the wilderness can throw at them!

148804.name: Brothers in Arms: D-Day
148804.description:
From the Box:

Two men. One story.

On the night before D-Day, the 101st Airborne parachuted behind enemy lines in Normandy. The hopes of the free world rested upon their shoulders. As either Sgt. Matt Baker or Cpl. Joe Hartsock, lead your Screaming Eagles into the largest airbourne invasion the world has ever known.

148805.name: Heroes Wear Masks
148805.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game puts you in the role of a brave adventurer fighting to survive in a world beset by magic and evil. It's a very short trip from there to the world of superheroes.

Pathfinder games and superhero fiction have a lot in common. They're both tales of powerful extraordinary individuals, some heroic, some definitely not, who go out and have adventures. Saving a town from being destroyed by a rampaging monster works equally well as a Pathfinder adventure or an issue of a comic book. Something about the core experience of Pathfinder and the superhero milieu fundamentally click. Heroes Wear Masks seeks to capitalize on that natural synergy and bring superheroes to Pathfinder.

Heroes Wear Masks is Pathfinder after it was bitten by a radioactive spider. If you're familiar with Pathfinder you'll recognize most of the rules. If you're familiar with superheroes you'll be familiar with most of the setting. If you're familiar with both, you'll be right at home here.

148806.description:
Return to the 18th century when Łazienki Królewskie (Royal Baths Park) was the summer residence of King Stanisław August Poniatowski. Deliver to the king the most gorgeous artwork and win the game!

Łazienki Królewskie, which literally means "Royal Baths", is the largest park in Warsaw, Poland. The park-and-palace complex lies on the "Royal Route" linking the Royal Castle with Wilanów palace to the south.

In the game Łazienki Królewskie, players use movement cards to try to meet the king walking around the park. When a meeting occurs, the artist delivers artwork and the player receives victory points. Each turn, the player can move up to three different artists and perform the corresponding actions or draw cards. The player who ends up with the biggest artwork collection — and thus the most victory points — wins.

The game has an educational value in that the artwork collected by players is real and can be seen in Łazienki Królewskie. Three real historical artists — Marcello Bacciarelli, André Le Brun and Jean Martin — are included in the game.
148806.name: Łazienki Królewskie

boardgamehonor: 2014 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended
148807.name: Hetzen nach Schätzen
148807.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The notorious pirate Captain Sabertooth is looking for a new crew member — but not just any pirate wannabe can join him. If the players want to be hired by Cap'n Sabertooth in Hetzen nach Schätzen, they'll have to prove to him how clever they are and join him on a treasure hunt! They need to run as fast as they can from one treasure chest to another to get rid of their pirate cards. Whoever first discards all of his pirate cards at the treasure chests correctly, then picks up Pirate Fex from the compass card wins this fast-paced treasure hunt!

148808.name: Schneckenschnell & bärenschwer
148808.description:
Game description from the publisher:

As speedy as a snail and as heavy as a bear — hmm, which is slower and which weighs more? As clever animal detectives who are always tracking down different animals, players in Schneckenschnell & bärenschwer have to answer questions like these and many others! At the three check stops, they receive valuable hints as to the animals' speed, size and weight. Whoever draws the right conclusions from the hints given can win the game. With this game, all players can broaden their animal knowledge in a fun way.

148809.name: Trailblazer: Teratologue
148809.description:
From publisher blurb:

Following on their revolutionary reinvention of the 3e rules, Bad Axe Games now unleashes over 500 monstrous pages of expanded stat blocks, design notes, customization options, and CR analysis. The Teratologue expands upon the innovative TRAILBLAZER ruleset by dissecting and reassembling the blood-and-guts of any fantasy campaign: the monsters!

Inside this massive tome you’ll find:

Reformatted stat blocks in a ready-to-use, at-the-table format.
Every special ability rewritten for clarity and consistency.
Complete stat blocks for every age category of all dragons.
Expanded tables for quick monster customization and advancement.
New rules for adding class levels and creating custom NPC classes.
Tons of design notes and advice to reduce the gamemaster’s workload.
Unique monsters and NPCs as envisioned by our patrons!




The TRAILBLAZER: Teratologue provides the power to surprise and challenge your players with truly unique creations.

NOTE: The eBook version of the Teratologue is a unique format, distinct from the printed version. Although the content is identical, the monsters in the eBook are presented no more than 1 monster per page, so that you can print out each monster before your game session, and make notes in the margins.

In addition, the eBook is fully hyperlinked, allowing you to jump from the Table of Contents or the Index directly to the monster entry you need.

148810.name: Remarkable Races: Compendium of Unusual PC Races
148810.description:
From publisher blurb:

This brilliantly illustrated compendium is 100% compatible wi4th Edition Dungeons & Drag and contains all you need to add fifteen new and unusual races to your campaign. Also included are over 100 new feats, a hoard of monster statistics, a score of new magic items, and other great racial resources to make these new races come to life. Whether you are DM looking for new options, or a player seeking something different, the Remarkable Races Compendium will breathe new life into your game!

This compendium contains all of the material in Remarkable Races RR001 through RR018, including the racial expansion sets, power cards, and all 30 cardstock minis. It also has a dozen more pages of bonus material! You get two copies with your purchase: one in stunning color without power icons, and one in black & white, with special power icons for easy printing and perusal.

148811.name: Remarkable Races Pathway to Adventure: Compendium of Unusual PC Races
rpgseries: Remarkable Races: Pathway to Adventure Edition
148811.description:
From publisher blurb:

This brilliantly illustrated compendium is 100% compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and contains all you need to add fifteen new and unusual races to your campaign. Also included are over 100 new feats, a hoard of monster statistics, a score of new magic items, and other great racial resources to make these new races come to life. Whether you are GM looking for new options, or a player seeking something different, the Remarkable Races Compendium will breathe new life into your game!

This compendium contains all of the material in Remarkable Races Pathway to Adventure: RRP01 through RRP15. It also has a dozen additional pages of new material. 30 cardstock minis are included as an added bonus!

148813.name: Babelo
148813.description:
Show me as I can't hear anything!
Draw without saying anything!
Tell me, but without saying too much!

In the party game Babelo, players compete individually or in teams to race across the board from start to finish. On a turn, the active player or team rolls a die, moves his pawn the indicated number of spaces, then secretly reads the word or phrase on the card associated with the number rolled. Depending on the color of the space where the pawn stands, the player now presents clues to the other players in a particular manner:


On a blue space, the player can use only gestures, as in charades. The player cannot write, draw, or make any sounds at all.



On a red space, the player must describe the phrase using only synonyms, descriptions and other words that suggest the phrase without repeating any part of it.



On a purple space, the player must draw the phrase without talking, gesturing, making sounds or writing any words.

148814.name: Boom Boom
148814.description:
Welcome to the best restaurant in the city! Guests can't wait to be seated and eat, so you need to work fast.

In Boom Boom, players try to complete sets of cards at the same time. When you complete a stack, ring the bell; for the second stack, ring twice. How many stacks do you still need? Oh no! Someone rang the bell again. Who will end the game?

Each player starts the game with a number of face-down card stacks, while the game board has four face-up cards on it. Playing at the same time, everyone looks through one of their stacks, exchanging one card from the chosen stack with one face-up on the board, if desired. Players can look through new stacks as they like, but only one stack at a time. As soon as you have a stack of four cards with the same person, ring the bell! The player who completes all of his stacks first wins.

148815.description:
Gobogeg, Sandy Petersen's Original Great Old One Miniature Figure for the Cthulhu Wars game.

Gobogeg, the Twice-Invoked. This is our interpretation of the awful vision which Danforth received in the final scenes of Lovecraft’s “At the Mountains of Madness”. Gobogeg is the embodiment of the Moon-Ladder – the final destruction of all Earth existence, as a new moon bursts forth from our surface, and the continents and seas dissolve into seething magma. Naturally enough, his presence changes the rules for ALL the players in Cthulhu Wars in a huge way.

The first player to Awaken Gobogeg takes the loyalty card, and places the figure on the map, under his control.

Gobogeg comes with its own unique power, plus if you can fulfill the requirement for its spellbook, you can enhance it even more.

Comes as the Cthulhu Wars Great Old One Pack Three.
148815.name: Cthulhu Wars: Great Old One Pack Three

148816.name: Katzulhu
148816.description:
From the introduction

"Welcome to Cathulhu (say cat-thoo-loo), an alternative setting which approaches Call of Cthulhu from a cat's-eye view! These additional rules connect the traditional Call of Cthulhu RPG with a feline milieu inspired by Akif Pirincci's Felidae and other novels."

A sub-genre rule expansion for Call of Cthulhu.


User notes

The German version was re-released in October 2013 as a pdf. It includes all rules, character sheets and two additional adventures:

Die Spur der Schwarzen Katzen (The trail of the black cats) by Ingo Ahrens
Der Fluch des Rattenwesens (The curse of the rat creature) by Frank Heller

148817.name: The Home Entertainment Shareware Collection: Vol. 6: Simulation Shareware Games
videogamecompilation: Crime Lab: Case Of The Missing Masterpiece
148817.description:
User Summary

This is a collection of DOS shareware, freeware and demonstration titles. Though the collection is called Simulation Shareware the player it contains a Defender variant, Scorched Earth and one of its clones, a movie database and a program for printing the instructions for making paper planes.

All programs are accessed via a shareware menu system which repeatedly displays its own registration reminders. Some programs can be run from the CD directly via this menu, others must be copied to the hard drive and the menu system will do that too.

Many titles have been misspelled or renamed, for example Scorched Earth appears in the menu as Scorch 2 and Pachisi is titled Parcheesy.

148818.name: Mini-Yonku GB: Let's & Go!! All-Star Battle MAX
148818.description:
Bakusō Kyōdai Let's & Go!! (爆走兄弟レッツ&ゴー!! Bakusō Kyōdai Rettsu Endo Gō!!?) is a manga by Tetsuhiro Koshita that appeared in CoroCoro Comic centered on Mini 4WD racing. It was later adapted into three TV anime series, each of which consisting of three 51-episode series, and was also made into several games. The series also released various merchandise, including CDs, trading cards, and stickers. Due to its early premiere date, the MAX series was the first anime to use TV Tokyo's current logo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bakusō Kyōdai Let's & Go!!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148819.name: Momotarou Dentetsu Jr. - Zenkoku Ramen Meguri no Maki
148819.description:
Momotaro Dentetsu (桃太郎電鉄 Momotarō Dentetsu, Momotarō Electric Railway) (also known by the abbreviated name Momotetsu) is a long-running board game-style video game series in Japan; in which players travel by rail, ship, and airplane; attempting to acquire wealth through business transactions buying properties; and dealing with rival entrepreneurs and nemeses such as the God of Poverty (貧乏神 Binbōgami?). The game mechanics are often compared to the board games sugoroku and Monopoly.

Started in 1988, the series was initially produced by Hudson Soft. The rights to the series are now owned by Konami Corporation, who absorbed Hudson in 2012. The title is commonly thought of as a play on the title for another video game series by Hudson Soft, Momotaro Densetsu, with which it is sometimes confused. The project supervisor for the series is Akira Sakuma, with illustration by Takayuki Doi (土居 孝幸?) and main music production by Kazuyuki Sekiguchi of Southern All Stars.

Source: Wikipedia, "Momotaro Dentetsu", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148820.name: Fushigi no Dungeon: Furai no Shiren GB: Tsukikagemura no Kaibutsu
148820.description:
User Summary

Japanese fishing game with RPG elements.

148821.name: God Medicine: Fantasy Sekai no Tanjou
148821.description:
User Summary

A company is developing an RPG called Phantom, but something mysteriously goes wrong and the company is destroyed. Suddenly a portal appears to the Phantom world from the game, which is discovered by three RPG loving children, Noah, Ken, and Miki. They gain the power of the Heroes' Souls upon the death of the Phantom world's chosen heroes and take it upon themselves to save the Phantom world and the real world from a Demon menace.

148822.name: Hon Shogi
148822.description:
User Summary

Shogi (将棋) is a game very similar to Chess. Shogi is played on a 9x9 board with 20 pieces. Gameplay is on a turn by turn
basis with black always going first.
