148823.name: Gegege no Kitarou: Youkai Souzoushu Arawaru!
148823.description:
User Summary

Similar to Pokemon where you train and battle different creatures, this game is based on a manga based on japanese folk-tales.
Gotta catch 'em, too!

148824.name: Gekitou Power Modeler
148824.description:
User Summary

RPG-elements and fantasy setting. Fight other dudes in power armor Tekken-style.

148825.name: Critters, Creatures, & Denizens
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
148825.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome one and all to Critters, Creatures, & Denizens.

A new book of monstrous surprises and new ideas for the Dungeon Crawl Classics Roll Play Game. In its pages are:

More than 120 Pre-generated DCC RPG compatible creature entries from the banal to the horrific with more than 400 variations for size and other subtypes.
More than 7 templates that transform the stock creatures into zombies, skeletons, lycanthropes, and more…
The guidelines and definitions needed to create your own creatures that will scale appropriately with the DCC RPG environment.
Two tables with more than 30 mutations so you can create so many variations that your grand children will still be using this manual to create original combinations!




Optional rules for:

Familiars, critters with class levels, and more…
Overland and table top movement for those who love a safari…
New sources for magic items…




Things you will not find in this work:

Treasure tables. Most creatures don’t bother, and the ones who do are likely to be using what ever it is against the players. Besides, every Judge and Storyteller has their own ideas on appropriate treasure so why bother to codify things with tables?
Threat ratings and encounter balancing architecture, because only you can know what your players can and cannot handle. Besides, the creatures of the wild don’t look for targets of equivalent strength. They hunt the weak, the sick, and the lame… aka: adventurers…

148826.name: Bone Hoard of the Dancing Horror
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
148826.description:
From publisher blurb:

Terrible horrors lurk in the workshop of Dellspero the Philosopher. Though Dellspero has been missing for ages, does his lair still contain the secret magics he worked with?

What terrible dancing horrors did Dellspero unleash when he offended the Chaos Lords.

Bone Hoard of the Dancing Horror is a Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game adventure designed for 2nd-level characters or can be easily adapted for use with higher or lower level characters.

All products in the Adventure Locale line present one or more dungeons that can be quickly picked up and used for a session of the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game.

148827.name: Sepulcher of the Mountain God
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
148827.description:
From publisher blurb:

Braving the hidden tomb of an ancient tribal king, the adventurers become embroiled in a quest directly from Ira, the Mountain God – find the Skull of Vyache and his magic club, Alceon, that were stolen by Bashkim and the twisted minions of Gelihedres.

Supulcher of the Mountain God is a Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game adventure designed for 8-10, 1st-level characters or can be easily adapted for use with higher or lower level characters.

All products in the Adventure Locale line present one or more dungeons that can be quickly picked up and used for a session of the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game.

148828.name: Through the Cotillion of Hours
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
148828.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sooner or later, characters are going to want to quest to achieve some specific end – to raise a fallen comrade, to regain lost ability points, to discover a new spell, to find some new magic item…the possibilities are nearly endless. This scenario can occur at any time during the course of overland travel, and gives characters the opportunity to meet some of these goals.

In this adventure, sleeping characters are invited to the Cotillion of Somnos, the Dreaming God. If they can make their way past the entertainments at the Masked Ball, they can petition the Dreaming God to fulfill some request on their behalf.

Through the Cotillion of Hours is a Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game adventure designed for any number of characters of any level.

148829.name: The Waystation
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
148829.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dwarves of Upanesh were prosperous and widespread; their transport/mining system was efficient and admirable. Their ancient downfall was tragic, but not without its heroes. Minoc Manshield and his mystical hammer Stone Fist, tools of the great god Upan saved many of his people and took many invaders with him, in the humble battleground of a Waystation… can you pierce the subterranean depths and recover Stone Fist? Who or what still remains in that desolate domain of death?

The Waystation is a DCC adventure designed for four to eight third level characters, that can easily be dropped into your campaign for a short ‘detour’, or be part of further adventures in the realms of the Upanesh. Stone Fist awaits!

148830.name: Stars in the Darkness
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
148830.description:
From publisher blurb:

In millennia past, the ancestors of the elves protected the stars as they followed their courses, for there are wolves in the outer dark. Yet what manner of creature would dare to consume stars as though they were sheep in the field? And what has become of the ancient starherds who once stopped such monsters? For such a monster is back - Urstah, the Star-Drinker. Stars are disappearing from the night sky, and with the loss of those stars, luck is being drained from the world. Your luck. Dare you enter the caverns, face the star-drinker, and release the stars in darkness?

Stars in the Darkness is a DCC adventure designed for four to eight, third level characters, that can easily be dropped into your campaign. In it, characters seek to stop an ancient evil from arising, with possibly devastating effects should they fail. This is our largest, and most epic, adventure for DCC to date.

148831.name: Operation: Marshal Law
148831.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first of Misfits Studios' conversions of Superlink 2e material to the Third Edition Super-Powered by M&M rules, Operation: Marshal Law details the US Marshal Service program intended to integrate super-powered beings into the agency as law enforcement officers.

Within this brief PDF you will find:

Mole Network, a new advantage for the new Organizations advantages category
The Revised Connected and Contacts advantages to allow relationships of greater detail into your game
The Ear to the Ground advantage
A US Marshal's field office built using the upcoming organization creation rules, including the office itself built using the new and revised headquarters rules
A template of traits for US Marshal training to allow your game's characters to join this agency
Three ideas for involving the US Marshal Service in your game




Note that the new headquarters and organizations rules rely upon as-yet unreleased content that will appear in Better Mousetrap 3e. All four advantages will also appear in the former work upon its release.

148832.name: Dungeon Dwellers
148832.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

In this offering you’ll find the carnivorous cube, a slow moving, gelatinous creature that absorbs and dissolves most anything it comes across, the mad mouther, a raving creature that drives foes mad long enough to feed upon them, a revised minotaur who can fill the role of a very capable dungeon guardian, and the subterranean, stench-emitting savages, troglodytes...

148833.name: Uno: Small World 2
148833.description:
User Summary

Game Boy version of the card game with a few extras.

148834.name: Dragons
148834.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

This time around, you find yourself presented with four new types of dragons to help, hinder, or gobble up your heroes. The arcane dragon is a reclusive creature that is said to be made of magic itself, and thus wields great arcane power. The mock dragon better not hear you call it that, or it won't help you when you need it most. The sand dragon, despite not being able to fly, has its eye on your magic items and will do whatever it takes to get them from you, including coming up from beneath your feet. The viper dragon has an attitude as bad as its venom is poisonous.

148835.name: Halloween Horrors
148835.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

This product offers a number of creatures intended to trouble a Gamemaster's heroes by offering new challenges and danger. In this special Halloween release you will find the death dragon, an ancient creature given a second chance through the dark process of undeath, the effigas, a spirit that exploits the living's attachment to representations to effigies to possess the latter and wreak havoc, the plague wraith, a victim of disease come back to spread the horror of its own demise, and reapers, elemental creatures unleashed to slay anything in their way for the cause of cosmic balance between life and death.

148836.name: More Dragons
148836.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

This product offers a number of creatures intended to trouble a Gamemaster’s heroes by offering new challenges and danger. This time around, you find yourself presented with yet four more new types of dragons to put the fear of the large and scaly into your heroes. The ice dragon lives in the frigid wastes and is driven by hunger that may cause it to seek out your heroes as its next meal. The reclusive mountain dragons are perhaps the largest type of dragon, which is a shame for anyone who settles near them considering how territorial they are. Sea dragons are a fickle, moody lot – one day they may guide your ship past hidden rocks but the next they may choose to sink it themselves. Lastly, swamp dragons possess a cruelty that is as toxic as their breath.

148837.name: Goblins
148837.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

In this offering you’ll find the beast wrangler, whose way with animals can swarm an opponent under with his bestial friends, the wolf rider who rides the mighty vargr canines into battle, and the commanding goblin lord, leader of the tribe. Also included is the ragefur mushroom, a narcotic that is poisonous to any other race, but drives goblins to a berserk rage.

148838.name: Dungeon Classics
148838.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

This product presents four classic dungeon dwelling monsters to harm, hinder, or gobble up your heroes.

In this product you will find the monstrously manta-like cloaker, masters of shadow and engulfing death, the shapeshifting and deadly mimic that can hide as anything from the chest you are trying to force open to the chair you are sitting in, the thought flayer, with its powerful psychic mind hidden behind a fearsome, squid-like face, and the floating sphere of incomparably dangerous eyeballs, the watcher.

Also included are three new powers, Charm, Mind Reading, and Telepathy.

148839.name: Capitales des ombres
148839.description:
Publisher blurb

Capitales des Ombres, le premier supplément géographique de Shadowrun, Quatrième édition, présente aux joueurs trois cancers urbains où règnent les Ombres : Hong Kong, Seattle et Marseille, en exclusivité dans la version française. Chaque ville est décrite en détail du point de vue d’un shadowrunner, dans une perspective couvrant les thèmes essentiels : équilibre des pouvoirs, affaires corporatistes et monde de la pègre, lieux importants, spécifi cités magiques et éléments propres à chaque ville – le tout foisonnant d’idées et d’accroches de scénarios.

Quatre autres cités chères aux runners sont également présentées : Le Cap, Caracas, Hambourg et Istanbul, le tout accompagné de conseils au meneur de jeu lui permettant de transformer n’importe quelle
zone urbaine en paradis pour runners.


user description

Capitales des ombres is the translation of Runner Havens with an added chapter on Marseilles in the shadows.


edition overview

Runner Havens was released in three different versions in Europe. All three add different city chapters to the ones on Seattle and Hong Kong included in the original:
Runner Havens (2006, fanpro US, 144 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong
Schattenstädte (2006, German translation by fanpro, 192 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Hamburg
Schattenstädte (Revised) (2010, German translation by Pegasus, 223 pages) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Hamburg, Marseille
Capitales des ombres (2008, French translation by BBE) - Main cities: Seattle, Hong Kong, Marseille

148840.name: Dragon Men
148840.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

In this product you will find the dragon men, creatures most likely born of dragonkind. Expanding on the materials presented in Player Races: Dragon Men, this product includes new monster entries using this race that can be used to aid or oppose your heroes.

The drakeherds are largely wingless dragon men who make up for this shortcoming by harnessing drakes as deadly war mounts in battle, the Guardians of Flame hold to an old creed and wander the land helping their people (whether they want it or not), the arcane dragon men sorcerer lords covet power, both worldly and mystic, and the warlords thirst only for battle. Rounding out this product are revised entries for the basic dragon man sorcerer and warrior.

148841.name: Namco Gallery Vol. 3
148841.description:
User Summary

Compilation of different Namco games for Game Boy ported from arcade and/or consoles. The Gallery was split into three volumes and only published in Japan.

Volume 3 contains
Sky Kid
Tower of Babel
Family Tennis
Jantaku Boy (mahjong)

148842.name: Out of the Dark
148842.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

In this product you will find four creatures that are born from or dwell in the darkness. These new monster entries will provide Gamemasters with new foes to spring out of the black upon their heroes when they least expect it.

Murderous killing machines, dark stone demons are born from the rocks of Hell where sinners trapped in the ground itself are merged together into new life by the crucible of demonic flame. Eaters in the deep are floating spheres sprouting numerous tentacle-like stalks, each of which ends in a muttering mouth that hungers for flesh. Hook flyers are tiny, stealthy predators that hide in the dark, waiting to swoop upon unsuspecting prey in order to drain their blood. Scourge wraiths are the tormented souls of those who once made their livelihood torturing others and must now stalk the dark, only finding peace in the pain and fear of others.

148844.name: Namco Gallery Vol. 1
148844.description:
User Summary

Compilation of different Namco games for Game Boy ported from arcade and/or consoles. The Gallery was split into three volumes and only published in Japan.

Volume 1 contains
Battle City
Galaga
Mappy
Namco Classic (golf)

148845.name: Dark Elves
148845.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Brief provides a small selection of new, revised, or expanded creatures to be pitted against your players.

In this product you will find the dark elves, beings exiled from the surface long ago for some forgotten transgression (or not-so-forgotten, depending upon your game), dark elves have ruled over their own matriarchal, wealthy civilizations in the depths of the Underearth for millennia. They are cruel, sadistic, and operate within a highly formalized caste system that makes extensive use of slaves, worship god-like demons of unspeakable, and has carved kingdoms of vast territories out of the darkness.

Behold the cursed arachni, half dark elf, half giant spider, and all rage and vengeance. From amongst dark elf society are the twisted painlords, torture masters and deadly combatants, the warlocks who have mastery over arcane magic but must still act subservient to the priestesses who rule dark elf society, yet even the latter must answer to the formidable high priestesses. And what of the Deepstalker Cult, a mysterious group of fanatics who somehow fulfill their secret agenda by hiring themselves out to other dark elves as assassins?

148846.name: Namco Gallery Vol. 2
148846.description:
User Summary
Compilation of different Namco games for Game Boy ported from arcade and/or consoles. The Gallery was split into three volumes and only published in Japan.

Volume 2 contains
Galaxian
Dig Dug
The Tower of Druaga
Famista 4 (exclusive for this compilation)

148847.name: Chou Majin Eiyuuden: Wataru Mazekko Monster
videogameseries: Chou Majin Eiyuuden: Wataru Mazekko Monster
148847.description:
User Summary

The goal in Chou Majin Eiyuuden is to hatch a creature from an egg and raise it. More creatures can also be obtained. Chou Majin Eiyuuden: Wataru Mazekko Monster is based off of an anime series called Chou Majin Eiyuuden Wataru.

148848.name: Chou Majin Eiyuuden: Wataru Mazekko Monster 2
videogameseries: Chou Majin Eiyuuden: Wataru Mazekko Monster
148848.description:
User Summary

The goal in Chou Majin Eiyuuden 2 is to hatch a creature from an egg and raise it similar to the first installment.
Chou Majin Eiyuuden: Wataru Mazekko Monster 2 is based off of an anime series called Chou Majin Eiyuuden Wataru.

148850.name: Stirb aufrecht, Kultist!
148850.description:
from the download description

Welcome to "Stirb aufrecht, Kultist!" ("Die upright, Cultist!")

The purpose of this sourcebook is to allow a game of Call of Cthulhu in the Wild West. It's up to the keeper to use the Western background just for one-time experience as a classic Western, or go down all the way to Spaghetti Westerns in the style of the "dollar" movies. But still, it is designed primarily to compete in the Wild West against cthuloid powers.

This publication contains all Western content from Cthuloide Welten magazine.

148851.name: Player Races: Dragon Men
148851.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product provides you with a new race your players may select to use while creating characters in your games. Aside from the base Racial Traits, within each product in this series you will find some Racial Edges, possibly some related Hindrances, new gear, and other materials of relevance to the new player race. In this particular product Misfit Studios gives you the dragon men.

Dragon men are an offshoot of the greater dragon race, and just like dragons they come in a number of variations (as found in the Monster Brief: Dragons and Monster Brief: More Dragons products), and so information is provided to customize the basic Racial Traits to suit each of them. Also included are nearly a dozen new Hindrances, including a sub-category unique to dragon men: Breeding Hindrances, representing what can go wrong when a dragon man breaks free of its shell. There are also over 20 new Edges, most of which are Racial Edges for dragon men (and, in some cases, other races with similar natural abilities.) Rounding out this product is a suit of armor that is tailored to a dragon man's unique anatomy, including an armor piece that allows them to turn their tails into weapons.

148852.name: Player Races: The Dark Elf
148852.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product provides you with a new race your players may select to use while creating characters in your games. Aside from the base racial Traits, within each product in this series you will find some Racial Edges, possibly some related Hindrances, new gear, and other materials of relevance to the new player race. In this particular product Misfit Studios gives you the dark elves.

In this offering you’ll find the dark elves, evil opposites to their surface-dwelling relations. Forced to flee underground in ages past, dark elves have become foul and dark, both in flesh and spirit, as they forged out new kingdoms in the deep darkness where they could offer up worship to their demon-gods. As a new player race, you may opt to become one of these dark elves, although exiled to live apart from your own kind but never accepted by other peoples due to the stigma of your kind.

148853.name: Player Races: Dwarves
148853.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product provides you with expanded information on a favorite race of fantasy settings: the dwarf.

Within are nearly a dozen new Racial Edges, stats for the dwarven waraxe, stoneblood ale, rules for adamantium and mithral, two metals used by dwarves to make superior weapons, the half-dwarf player race, and a new power trapping: Earth/Stone.

148854.name: Jinsei Game - The Game of Life
148854.description:
Jinsei Game (人生ゲーム) is the Japanese version of the board game that is called The Game of Life in North America. Unlike The Game of Life, the player starts in his toddler years and has to go to elementary school, junior high school, and high school before being allowed to either go to university or start his career. However, the board game has been updated numerous times like its North American counterpart.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jinsei Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148855.name: Character Conversion Guide
148855.description:
Publisher blurb

Upgrade to Fifth Edition!

Have you been playing Shadowrun, Fourth Edition for a while? Do you want to play the new, hot-selling, well-reviewed Shadowrun, Fifth Edition without abandoning your existing character? Then we’ve got the document for you! In a handful of quick steps, the SR5 Character Conversion Guide gets your Fourth Edition character ready to rock and roll in Fifth Edition!


user description

Provides rules and tables to convert SR4 and SR4A characters to SR5.

148856.name: Dirty Cops
148856.description:
from the Score:
just a little taste...
The cops in El Centro have a unique motto—Bad Cop, Bad Cop. Anyone whose ever been brought in for questioning here knows to tell the truth, or wake up in a cell with a criminal who is far worse than you.

Beatings are always an option too.

But that’s not the worst of it. The worst is that the cops here are just as dirty as the criminals. They take bribes, sell information to pushers, and generally keep a close watch on the criminals doing them the most favors.

Which is great for the status quo.

But what happens when an investigation stumbles into territory other dirty cops are trying to cover up? Or maybe someone is ready to squeal to protect his ass? And let’s not forget about the ambitious prosecutor looking to nail someone’s ass to the wall?

What then?

148857.name: Monster Maker
148857.description:
User Summary

Monster maker is based on a famous japanese card game from 1988. Part of its popularity probably stems thanks to Kugatsuhime's cute and colorful illustrations. The card game inspired several series of Role Playing Games, comic books, novels and several video games for Game Boy, NES and Super NES.
Monster Maker (this version) was the first game in the series.

148858.name: Dark Dark Fantasy
148858.description:
from the Score:
The wizard and the map are dead

Mordor won. The sun has turned black. Ash and cinder coat the landscape. Famine. Plague. The list goes on.

Whatever life is left... it isn’t good.

Gold hoards are rumored everywhere. Everyone knows someone who knows someone who has a map. Or a trinket. Or some forgotten bit of history. But what does any of that matter when there’s nothing of value anymore and life is cheap. Subsistence and meager survival matter for most.

But for a small few, life is a little different.

Adventurers stand out from the norm. While most dig in the mud, eking out what little food they can to survive, opportunists — thugish, cruel opportunists — pass through the landscape stealing what they can and slaying to keep it.

If life is going to be short, ugly, messy, and sweaty, then they are going to get theirs as quickly as possible.

This is a dark fantasy fiasco.

148859.name: Road Trip
148859.description:
from the Score:
JUST 500 MORE MILES AND THEN WE’LL STOP

It was supposed to be a simple trip. A one-way trip. Me and some Friends. A hitch-hiker or two. And a simple delivery.

That’s all.

Just one simple delivery.

What could possibly go wrong?

148860.name: The Ace
148860.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this product you will find details on the Ace profession tree. An Ace is someone with an exceptional ability to push a vehicle (and himself) beyond its normal boundaries, squeezing nigh-preternatural performance out of their machines. They can endeavor to attain new heights of speed, keep their vehicle together when it should be shaking apart, and force it to achieve feats of daring that should be impossible.

In order to allow for character specialization, many Edges of the Ace profession tree have been broken down into three variations on the same effect, separating the mechanics between aircraft, ground vehicles, and watercraft. However, by all means combine the Edges into a single version of the end result if you think a more generalized approach better suits your game.

148861.name: The Dirt People Annex
148861.description:
User summary:
A table of additional locations for use with JP01: The Dirt People

designer's blog comment:
I should add that I don’t think the locations is quite finished the way it is, so I went ahead and made another page to cover everything else I could think of. Also note, I really wanted to add the “Day Old Bread Store” but there was no room.

148862.description:
Night Shift is a Solitaire board game with Survival Horror themes. It describes the efforts of three different characters (an FBI agent, a security guard, and a mercenary) as they seek to survive a night of Lovecraftian horror as monsters and madness descend upon a storage facility nestled between the sea and a spooky wood.

The game is played out on an 8x8 hex grid and simulates the escape of a character through a simple set of movement and action rules. Enemies actions are controlled by a simple set of A.I., unique to each enemy, while the scenario to be played can be determined randomly and can be modified slightly according to preference or dice roll. The main driving force of the game is a narrative table, aptly called the Horror Table, which produces results that apply mechanical changes to game play as well as describe the nature of the dark events befalling your character. Couple with a search table, Night Shift creates an environment rife with spooky stuff.

This game was originally created for the 2013 Solitaire Print and Play contest.
148862.name: Night Shift

148863.name: OSRIC Pocket SRD (2nd Edition)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148863.description:
From publisher blurb:

Includes all Knights-n-Knaves errata through January 2013

This book represents a compilation of rules for old school-style fantasy roleplay gaming, and is intended to reproduce the underlying rules used in the late 1970s to early 1980s. A complete game manual in itself, this source reference document (SRD) includes everything the game master and player alike require for beginning to advanced level play. This compact A5 trim of the OSRIC SRD is available exclusively through James D. Kramer contains the OSRIC rules, complete with indexes. Includes all Knights-n-Knaves.com errata through January 2013, and updated magic item tables.

148864.name: Slabberjan
boardgameversion: Cloth bag in blue-white ceramic tile design edition
148864.description:
A traditional Dutch game from the Zeeland region, very similar to the version of the Danish-Norwegian game Gnav played with wooden pawns rather than cards, of which it is a derivative.

A set consists of 42 wooden pawns with a number or picture hidden under the base. Each of the 21 subject occurs twice: the numbers from 0 to 12, the trumps "Rider", "Bird", "Cat" and "Inn" above the numbers, and "Whitebread", "Mug", "Pot" and "Jester" below.

At the beginning of the game, each player recieves a number of point tokens. In each round, each player draws one pawn from a bag and secretly looks at its value. Then the players in order decides whether to keep their pawn or trade it with the following player. If that player holds a trump, special rules for each trump applies, otherwise the pawns are traded. At the end of the round, the player with the lowest valued pawn loses one of their point tokens.

A player who runs out of point tokens is out of the game. The last remaining player is the winner.

It is not known exactly when this little known variant first appeared. It must be after the the wooden pawn variant of Gnav – originally a card game – gained popularity as an effect of a ban on playing cards by the pietist king Christian VI of Denmark-Norway (1730–1746). On the other hand it probably did not happen very much later, as it lacks a couple of the developments otherwise separating Gnav from other games in the Cuccu family.

148865.name: The Stolen Heir
148865.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Mendevian Crusade draws heavily on the Pathfinder Society’s resources, and unless the Decemvirate can secure the assistance of generous patrons, the society may not have sufficient capital both to fight off the demonic invasion and to prepare its expedition to a lost historical site within the Worldwound. Upon hearing that the daughter of an eminent and wealthy of citizen of Sauerton has gone missing, the Pathfinders rush to her aid in the hope of earning her father’s goodwill and support in upcoming endeavors.

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1–5.

This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

148866.name: Straight Jacket
148866.description:
From the introduction to the rules:

Straight Jacket is a fast, fun card game for 3 or more players — 4 or 5 is best.

In Straight Jacket, the players take on the roles of inmates wearing straight jackets and trapped in a padded cell. All of you want to escape, but you’re not exactly pragmatic about it. The person with the most points at the end of the games, wriggles from their jacket and escapes.

User summary:

The deck consists of 75 poker-sized cards.

Players draw up to three cards to form a hand of three, play the lowest value card from their hand of three to their play area, then pass one card each to the left and right of them. Cards may have instructions which are to be followed when they are played. Play continues until the draw pile is exhausted.

148867.name: The Elven Entanglement
148867.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Nearly every nation has contributed to the Mendevian Crusade, but few are willing to send additional aid to assist the Pathfinder Society directly. Owed a favor the elves cannot refuse, Pathfinders travel to Kyonin to secure a force of some of the finest demon-hunters in Avistan only to find that the hunters are missing in action. Can the Pathfinders extract the lost elves from the depths of Tanglebriar, or will they become the latest casualties of Treerazer’s domain?

A Pathfinder Society Scenarios for levels 7–11.

This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

148868.name: You Have What You Hold
148868.description:
publisher blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3–7.

As an act of retribution, an enemy of the society begins hiring river pirates to waylay Pathfinder boats bound for the crusader nation of Mendev. Unless the Pathfinders can track down the party responsible and put an end to their piracy, the raids may spell the doom of the society’s ambitions to the north.

Content in "You Have What You Hold" also contributes directly to the ongoing storyline of the Sczarni faction.

Written by Sean McGowan.

This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

148869.name: Port Godless
148869.description:
publisher blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5–9.

Few are as adept at fighting demons as the Riftwardens, an organization of spellcasters dedicated to protecting the boundaries between the planes. Many are already committed to the Fifth Crusade in Mendev and are unable to assist the Pathfinders directly in the society’s upcoming expedition into the Worldwound, but if the Pathfinders assist the Riftwardens elsewhere, perhaps a small number of the mages might be free to return the favor. Unfortunately, this means entering the godless nation Rahadoum, where several Riftwardens have recently disappeared.

Content in "Port Godless" also contributes directly to the ongoing storylines of the Cheliax, Osirion, and Qadira factions.

Written by Ben McFarland.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148870.name: The Pyramid of Gorsh
148870.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pyramid of Gorsh pits the adventurers against an unknown alien race within a mysterious, ancient pyramid.

Return with us to the good ‘ol days when ’plot’ was just a four-letter word that stood between you and the treasure.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148871.name: Cloud World of Arme
148871.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cloud World of Arme is an exploratory foray into the clouded domain of the cloud giant king, Arme. You players will marvel at the riches to had among the denizens of this castle in the sky.

Return with us to the good ‘ol days when ’plot’ was just a four-letter word that stood between you and the treasure.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148872.name: Foray into the Wilderness
148872.description:
From publisher blurb:

Foray into the Wilderness throws your band of intrepid adventurers onto a path crossing lands inhabited by orcs, dragons, and other fearsome adversaries.

Return with us to the good ‘ol days when ’plot’ was just a four-letter word that stood between you and the treasure.

148873.name: Keep on the Borderlands: The Expansion
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148873.description:
From publisher blurb:

Keep on the Borderlands: The Expansion returns your players to the setting of one of the most notorious modules released by TSR, The Keep on the Borderlands. This adventure provides additional overland encounters, as well as additional Caves of Chaos for your players to explore.

Return with us to the good ‘ol days when ’plot’ was just a four-letter word that stood between you and the treasure.

148874.description:
Splush is a group-gathering game for Shibumi that uses entries and slide drops. The board starts as shown below:

● ○ ● ○
○ ● ○ ●
● ○ ● ○
○ ● ○ ●

Players then take turns either:


Entering a ball of their color from the side onto a 2x2 platform, which may push other balls, or



Removing a ball of their color and entering it back into play as per move 1; this removal may cause a drop.


Entering a ball may cause a drop but may not push any balls off the board. You cannot enter a ball onto any ball that has just
dropped as part of the move. A player wins by connecting all of their visible balls (when viewed from above) into a single connected group.
148874.name: Splush

148875.name: Usherwood Adventures Expansion for OSRIC
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148875.description:
From publisher blurb:

This new second edition includes new creatures, new magic, and new optional OSRIC rules not appearing in any other Usherwood Publishing product.

This OSRIC expansion material includes;

New character race options;
Dragon Hordling; a tortured half-breed mixture of human and dragon. Use the creature's ability of limited flight and minor breath weapon to your advantage.
Half-orcs; two new sub-races of orcish original. The more intelligent goblinesque is allowed to become a magic-user of minor power, and the brutish orgre is a berserking behemoth.
Sarngoch; a mysterious race, taller than humans, and more charismatic than elfs. These demi-humans of noble appearance have an innate ability to cast limited arcane spells. But the magic within them is both a blessing and a curse!

New character class options;
The Jack-of-All-Trades; build a character whose skills are as unique as his carefully-crafted personality. Includes skills from the archetypical classes; assassin, cleric, druid, fighter, illusionist, magic-user, paladin, ranger, thief. Even include talents from new Usherwood class; the Vermean Monk.
The Vermean Bard;not just a single class with a broad range of unrelated skills. The Vermean Bard is a collection 7 different, yet related, minstrel classes;
Jongleur Magsman; combining both thief and bard skills
Lorist Priest; combining both cleric and bard skills
Lorist Ovate; combining both druid and bard skills
Lyrist Veteran; combining both fighter and bard skills
Sonneteer Magician; combining both magic-user and bard skills
Sonneteer Trickster; combining both illusionist and bard skills
Racaraide Bard; a true adventuring bard

The Vermean Monk; a new take on the classic First Edition monk is a martial arts master, without the supernatural abilities that can unbalance your campaign.

Challenge your players with 28 new monsters, including six new species of dragon.
Reward your players with 10 new magical armor, weapons, and miscellaneous magic items.
Open adventuring possibilities with Usherwood's take on psionics; re-written from the First Edition appendix. These rules governing psionics are more spell-like in the way they are handled, and more easily incorporated into your campaign. This section also includes 14 psionically-sensitive monsters to challenge the would-be mentalists in your group.




Inspired by the Usherwood Adventures campaign setting, the material contained in the Usherwood Adventures Expansion for OSRIC is completely setting-agnostic, and easily adaptable to your campaign world. 122 pages of new material, much of it never published previously, and only to be made available in this publication.

148876.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 148 - Dec 1987)
148876.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #148
December 1987

Cover art by Scott Ruggels.

148878.name: Karakuri Kengou Den Musashi Lord
148878.description:
User Summary

Based on the japanese manga series "Musashi, the Samurai Lord", which was aired on Nippon-TV in 1990-91.
You play Musashi and have to fight enemies and bosses Zelda-style.

148880.name: Famista 2
148880.description:
User Summary

Famista 2 is the second game of a trio of baseball games for the Game Boy. It plays much like any other baseball game of the era, with simple controls and a fairly minimal approach. There are two modes: Pennant Race (play a season against every other team, plus two bonus teams at the end), and All Stars (play an exhibition game using "all-star" teams).

148882.name: Momotarou Dengeki: Momotaro Thunderbolt
148882.description:
Momotaro Densetsu (桃太郎伝説 Momotarō Densetsu, Peachboy Legend) (also known by the abbreviated name Momoden) is a role-playing video game series in Japan featuring the character Momotarō from Japanese folklore, as well as other Japanese folklore characters such as Kintarō, Urashima Tarō, and Princess Kaguya of The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter.

Started in 1987, the series was initially produced by Hudson Soft. Konami absorbed the company in 2012, and thus now owns the rights to the series. The title is sometimes confused with that of Momotaro Dentetsu, another video game series by Hudson Soft. As with Momotaro Dentetsu, the project supervisor for the Momotaro Densetsu series is Akira Sakuma, with illustration by Takayuki Doi (土居 孝幸?) and main music production by Kazuyuki Sekiguchi of Southern All Stars.

In addition to the Momotaro Densetsu and Momotaro Dentetsu series, Hudson has produced several other video games in the Momotaro franchise, including the Momotaro Festival (桃太郎まつり Momotarō Matsuri?) series, the Momotaro Thunderbolt (桃太郎電劇 Momotarō Dengeki?) series, and Momotaro Katsugeki (桃太郎活劇?).

A Momotaro Densetsu anime series was also broadcast, which had its own spinoff, PEACH COMMAND: New Peachboy Legend (PEACH COMMAND 新桃太郎伝説?), featuring a different storyline set in outer space.

Source: Wikipedia, "Momotaro Densetsu", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148883.name: Chibi Maruko-Chan Okozukai Daisakusen!
148883.description:
User Summary

Chibi Maruko-chan wants to acquire five items from the local store. However, the total cost of the five items comes to 10350¥, while Maruko starts the game off with only 30¥ to her name. In order to purchase all 5 items, you must go around challenging townspeople to one of several games in order to make money.

148884.name: Family Jockey
148884.description:
User Summary

Japanese horse racing game first developed for the NES and ported to the Game Boy.

To progress through the game, you must steer your Jockey and horse within the top 4 in each race. You gain prize money for position 1 through 3, and an extra bonus for beating the course record. A secondary objective is also beating the high score of the game.

148885.name: Jinsei Game Densetsu
148885.description:
User Summary

Japanese adaptation of the MB game "Game of Life" in a fantasy setting. Roll and move...

148886.name: Kitchen Panic
148886.description:
User Summary

Japanese jump and run game. Defeat nasty bugs in your kitchen to keep it clean.

148887.name: Number Ten
148887.description:
"The Game of Promises and Ultimate Power" is mostly a roll & move design with some negotiation and voting in the long version of the game.

Themed around British politics with the iconic black door of 10 Downing Street as the box art, the object of this game is to become Prime Minister. In the short version of the game, the winner is the first person to do so whereas in the long version, the role of Prime Minister can change hands and the game is said to be won by "the last person to remain in the game after all the other players have tired of the Prime Minister's leadership".

Players roll and move their way around the board, trying to pick up Vote cards and debating other players if they land on the same space. In the short version, such debates are decided by rolling dice but in the long version the players must act out their side of the debate and the winner is chosen by a vote of the other players. Players must also face "chance"-like Affairs cards when they roll doubles and may end up in Jail or Hospital where they must roll dice to be set free.

Players consecutively work their way through the Town Hall, Parliament and Ministry spaces to reach Number Ten. They are paid a higher salary for reaching each of those levels but then require a greater number of votes to proceed to the next. In the long game, the current Prime Minister can influence this process by exercising special powers such as awarding a government grant to a player or sending someone to Jail.

148888.name: Aurora (Volume 7, Issue 4 - Oct 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Heavy Gear Blitz! Quick Reference Guide

148889.name: Aladdin
148889.description:
Dice-game for 2-4 players.

A roll and move game where you should be first to reach number 39. If you land on a number with a 2 or 6 then you have to move backwards 2 or 6 steps. If you land on number 10 you have to start all over again.

148890.name: Invasive Species: The Game
148890.description:
Auuuuuuuugh! Your publisher is breathing down your neck, so now it's a late-night, caffeine-fueled, rattling-keyboard-pounding race to get the first chapter of your thriller novel Invasive Species finished before he decides to tear up your lucrative contract. Through blind inspiration (drawing cards) and expert cut-and-paste editing (arranging cards on your board), you strive to complete your chapter before it's too late.

In the card game Invasive Species, players create a story by using 36 cards that have numbered text showing where each card should go in the story. Each turn, a player draws a card and decides whether he wants to keep it or give it to his opponent. He places any kept cards on his personal board, with the goal of creating an ascending numeral sequence. When the deck runs out, players take turns sliding misplaced cards into their correct positions. The first player to correctly "write" his story wins.

Invasive Species is based on the novel of the same name by Mike Mayer.

148891.name: October 2013: Things That Go "Crash" in the Night 4 - Patient Zero
148891.description:
From Introduction:

What was the infection that started all infections? Whose unspeakable illness broke the bounds of life and death to occupy a horrible area in between? This unfortunate individual has been designated “Patient Zero”. This person has been subjected to a terror unlike the world has seen before, a terror so great that it infected the world around them.

148893.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 160 - Dec 1988)
148893.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #160
December 1988

Cover art by Jon Marshall.

148894.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 161 - Jan 1989)
148894.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #161
January 1989

Cover artist stated as unknown.

148895.name: Pocket Bass Fishing
148895.description:
User Summary

Fishing for the Game Boy. Drive around in your boat, throw out your lure and fish some fish.

As exciting as real fishing. For your pocket!

148897.name: Totsugeki! Ponkotsu Tank
148897.description:
User Summary

Drive a small tank through 5 stages and kill everything you see.

148898.name: Taikyoku Renju
148898.description:
User Summary

GO for the Game Boy.

148899.name: Jantaku Boy
148899.description:
User Summary

Dominoes variant for the Game Boy.

148900.name: Millenniums & Mutations
148900.description:
website blurb:
Millenniums & Mutations™ is a supplement to be used with the Tunnels & Trolls™ role-playing game, that allows you to create adventures in a futuristic post-apocalyptic world of adventure. This supplement will provide you with enough information to have you off and running in this radiation altered land where thousands of years have passed since a catastrophe has destroyed life as we know it.

This is not a stand-alone game. You will need to get yourself a copy of the Tunnels & Trolls™ role-playing game created by Ken St. Andre. Any version should suffice, but this supplement focuses on 5th and 7th editions of the game.

148901.name: The World of Zendynn (T&T 5)
148901.description:
from the introduction:
The World of Zendynn is a supplement for the Millenniums & Mutations game that provides a map of the known world, along with 300 creatures and 100 robots to use in designing your adventures in this post-apocalyptic world. There are versions of Zendynn that is dependent on the version of Tunnels & Trolls you are using.

from the footnotes:
Creatures for Zendynn are from the Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy Role-Playing Game Broken Urthe converted for use with Millenniums & Mutations.

User comment:
This version of the setting book has statistics compatible with Tunnels & Trolls (5th - 5.5 Edition). There is an alternate edition with statistics for Tunnels & Trolls (7th - 7.5 Editions).

148902.name: The World of Zendynn (T&T 7)
148902.description:
from the introduction:
The World of Zendynn is a supplement for the Millenniums & Mutations game that provides a map of the known world, along with 300 creatures and 100 robots to use in designing your adventures in this post-apocalyptic world. There are versions of Zendynn that is dependent on the version of Tunnels & Trolls you are using.

from the footnotes:
Creatures for Zendynn are from the Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy Role-Playing Game Broken Urthe converted for use with Millenniums & Mutations.

User comment:
This version of the setting book has statistics compatible with Tunnels & Trolls (7th - 7.5 Editions). There is an alternate edition with statistics for Tunnels & Trolls (5th - 5.5 Edition).

148903.name: The Vile Worm (S&W)
148903.description:
from the adventure background:
Deep within the forest, an ancient oak has grown huge, twisted, and evil. Ages ago, a savage cult haunted these woods and this tree became the focus of their unspeakable rites. Below it, they carved out a chamber of sacrificial horror where innocent victims were offered to a hideous worm-like god. As the centuries passed, the cult faded into the mists of time, but the twisted old oak stood fast, awaiting the day when the creeping evil in the dark below would be summoned once more.

from the introduction:
This module is a short, but challenging scenario for a party of low-level characters.

148904.name: Dreamcast Twin Stick Controller
148904.description:
The Dreamcast Twin Stick is a special controller designed mainly for Cyber Troopers Virtual-On: Oratorio Tangram. As the name suggests, it contains two joysticks at the expense of fewer buttons. It also contains a VMU slot.

Japanese only release.

148905.name: The Twice-Robbed Tomb
rpgseries: B - Purple Duck Games Basic Level Adventures
148905.description:
from the introduction:
A Labyrinth Lords adventure for 4 characters of 3rd level, or 6 or more of 2nd level.

The domination of Pheniket the Pharaonic ended nearly two centuries ago, but stories of his ruthless ambition still haunt the region. An intruder from a sandy land to the south, with strange gods and customs, Pheniket tried to establish a colony of one in the land, and nearly succeeded. Those that followed his power did so zealously, and seemed even to love the enigmatic tyrant. His strength came from arcane pacts forbidden in his homeland, that enabled him to cause his enemies
to disappear, and gave him vast knowledge.

* * *

Legends wax and wane, and 150 years later, intrepid treasure hunters came to the settlement nearest Pheniket’s palace and announced that they had uncovered the Pharaonic’s tomb. They looted it, with some opposition (some animated dead, a few poorly constructed golems) and came back with an armload of magic weapons, armor, and Pheniket’s grave goods. Minor prosperity hit the area for a time, not appreciated by all. Those that knew the now-deceased tomb-robbers well also know that there was part of the tomb that could not be accessed by the original discoverers, who were happy to leave with what they had, as a feeling of dark foreboding saturated that forgotten place, a malevolent presence guarding the true prize in Pheniket’s resting place.

148906.name: Return of the Rat Cult
rpgseries: B - Purple Duck Games Basic Level Adventures
148906.description:
excerpted from the introduction:
A Labyrinth Lords Adventure for 4-6 level 2 or 3 characters.

The town of Felton, a grain and livestock center for the region, has been plagued over the years with infestations of rats seeking the bounty of stored grain, animal flesh, and the offal of both. It rains a lot in Felton, and cats, the usual solution, do not do well in the damp...

Many adventuring careers here have started out with the skills of rat-catcher. There are some, however, who sought a different answer to the problem — elevating the prevalent vermin to the status of indestructible god, and giving worship.

The Servants of the Small God, usually referred to as the Rat Cult, emerge from time to time, especially after a particularly despoiled harvest in Felton.

Recently though, after a particularly bad harvest, the Cult rose with a vengeance.

As the party arrives in town, the situation is dire. ... A dozen of the townsfolk have disappeared, and the full moon, typical time of sacrifice as demanded by the Servants, is fast approaching. Panic is beginning to set in, and time is short.

148907.name: Galaxy Dice
148907.description:
From the Box:
In this "push your luck" dice game, players attempt to acquire stages by matching their dice rolls to the icons on the card. These cards make you more powerful against the bosses. Each boss that falls before you unlocks a more powerful die. Once a player has defeated a set number of bosses, the game is over and the person with the highest core is the winner.

Featuring all pixel artwork, 5 unique scrolling stages, 20 enemies, 5 bosses, and even Basic and Advanced variants.

148908.name: Run, Fight, or Die!: Guy Promo Character Board
148908.description:
This promotional character board was handed out at GenCon 2013 if you participated in a demo of "Run, Fight, or Die!" It illustrates the character "Guy."

It was also shipped as a reward to the Kickstarter backers in 2014

148909.name: WWE Wrestlemania 21
148909.description:
User Summary

WWE Wrestlemania 21 is an Xbox exclusive WWE game which focuses around playing as a WWE superstar and seeking a championship at Wrestlemania 21. The game's claim to originality is that it featured extensive online action, including the ability to create a title and put it on the line against online opponents.

148910.description:
Description:
Castle Defenders combines the strategy elements of chess with a spell system like Magic: the Gathering™. It was inspired by the brilliant video game Hero Academy™ for iOS and contains similar gameplay mechanics. The combat system has been simplified to better fit the physical board game format.

Goal:
Players send units to attack enemy castles and defend their own. You win by destroying all enemy castles OR units.

Gameplay:
-The game board resembles a rectangular chess board. Players agree on a layout and arrange their castles and bonus tiles (extra attack, shields, or bonus castle damage).
-Players maintain a 6-card hand from their personal deck containing units (mage, healer, knight, etc.), spells, and equipment.
-On their turn, players choose 5 actions to perform (cast a spell, move a unit, attack, heal, etc...).
-Part of the game is trying out different moves to find the best plan, so you decide when your move is final.
-Players receive bonus spell cards when two of their units are destroyed (this balances gameplay and allows you to counter an opponent's momentum).

Strategy elements:
-Units have strengths/weaknesses and must work as a team.
-Formations help reinforce attack/defense effectiveness.
-Board location and unit placement is key (e.g. "Is my Knight far enough away to avoid being knocked out?" "Is my Archer close enough to knock out the enemy Healer?").
-Unit trading: killing enemy units can leave yours exposed...is it worth the risk?
148910.name: Castle Defenders

148911.description: Wilderness: Female Characters is an accessory pack consisting of three female characters for Wilderness, along with health boards and stickers. These characters can be used to substitute for the blue, green and yellow male characters.
boardgameaccessory: Wilderness
148911.name: Wilderness: Female Characters

148912.name: Train Sim Activity Pack
148912.description:
From the packaging

Over 30 challenging activities to upgrade your railroad experience are included in this professionally designed package for Microsoft Train Simulator. Whether you're tasked with transporting the injured from the Blitz in wartime Britain, or coping with a hectic schedule in modern-day Japan there is something here for every level of ability and interest. You will need to make swift decisions and your driving skills will be pushed to the limit! Luckily you are not on your own 0 comprehensive printed documentation both educates and entertains budding drivers, with maps and full explanations of what lies ahead.

OVER 30 PROFESSIONALLY DEVELOPED ACTIVITIES FOR TRAIN SIMULATOR!

148913.name: Rabat
148913.description:
Trade gems in Rabat: a fast-paced, frantic and loud card game. You need to react fast and try not to loose track.

5 Gem cards and 3 mission cards are displayed in the middle of the table.

All players play simultaneously trade single gem cards with the displayed cards on the table or other players as fast as they can. The first to have the exact match for a mission card shouts "rabat," discards his cards and gets the mission card, then draws 5 new gem cards and reveals a new mission card to trade gems for.

Each mission card is worth points. When there are no more mission cards left the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

148914.name: 3 Grandes Aventures Historiques
videogamedeveloper: Editions de la Réunion des musées nationaux
videogamecompilation: Egypt 1156 B.C.: Tomb of the Pharaoh
148914.description:
User Summary

This is a big box compilation containing three of Cryo's adventure games:

•Versailles: Complot à la Cour du Roi Soleil also known as Versailles 1685,
•Chine: Intrigue dans la Cité Interdite also known as China: The Forbidden City, and
•Egypte 1156 av. J.-C.: L'énigme de la Tombe Royale also called Egypt 1156 B.C.: Tomb of the Pharaoh.

148915.name: The Courtyard of Hell
148915.description:
Publisher blurb:

"It wasn't hell. It was the courtyard of hell. It was a maelstrom of noise and hot, splitting steel... the rattling of machine guns never stops... wounded men refuse to leave, and the men don't want to be relieved after seven days and seven nights... the battlefield is still an appalling thing to see, in its mud, ruin, dead, and its blight and desolation."

--Matthew Halton, War Correspondent
Canadian Broadcasting Corporation

The Courtyard of Hell is an adventure campaign for GODLIKE: Superhero Roleplaying in a World on Fire, the critically acclaimed game of deadly action and superheroic courage in World War 2.

It's late December, 1943, just after the bloody crossing of the Moro River. The players' superpowered Talents accompany the soldiers of the 2nd Brigade, the Loyal Edmonton Regiment, the Seaforth Highlanders of Canada, and Princess Patricia's Canadian Light Infantry, as they attempt to wrest the town of Ortona from a regiment of elite German paratroopers. It's a battle so ferocious that Churchill will call it "Little Stalingrad." It's a battle that the survivors will never forget.

The Courtyard of Hell includes:

- Guidelines for character creation and seven pregenerated characters, ready to play.
- Tips for presenting large-scale combat scenes.
- New Canadian and German weapons and vehicles.
- "One Roll Cityfight" rules for detailed encounters.
- Enough adventures for months of thrilling gaming.

The Courtyard of Hell is written by Allan Goodall, author of the Godlike campaign Black Devils Brigade and the Wild Talents setting book This Favored Land.

148917.name: Blazing Games
148917.description:
User Summary

This is a compilation of fifty, fully licensed games which are grouped into five categories, Arcade, Board, Cards/Dice, Logic Puzzle and Puzzle. The product installs a game menu which is then used to access each games which are then run direct from the CD. Both the menu and the games run in a non-resizable window.

148918.description:
Scriba is yet another Scrabble clone. Quite popular on Polish market due to much lower price.

Scriba is an extended version of Scriba Travel, because it provides two variants of gameplay. The first variant is exactly the same, but the second is quite insane.

The first variant is similar to Scrabble (but there are some differences). Players use their 6/7/8 (this is up to the players) drawn letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word laid out earns points based on the commonality of the letters used, with certain board spaces giving bonuses. But a word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word. The differences between Scriba (1st variant) and Scrabble are:
- If you play all but one letter from your rack you get 20 points bonus.
- You can stack the letters on top of the already played (like in Upwords), but only two levels of letters are allowed
- There are negative bonuses on the board.
- The player that ends the game receive 50 points bonus (because he played all his letters, we don't mind if he had one or two).
- If a player passes, he receives minus 5 points.
- The are tiles with no letter but with a black spot. This can be placed anywhere adjacent to already played tiles and is usually used to prevent from extending a particular word.
- The are tiles with a curved arrow (wich looks like 'enter key') which allows to play a word half vertically and half horizontally.

The second variant uses every rule from first variant with some additional rules:
- The players use chips in four colors to place all the bonuses on the board wherever they want.
- Whenever a player uses the bonus, he takes the chip from the board and places it in front of him. Every chip is worth 1 point during the final scoring.
- The start player does not have to place his first word in the middle of the board.
- After every move the player roll a d6 and draws that number of letter-tiles.
- There are 12 big yellow chips which at the start of the game are distributed to the players in equal shares. Every chip is worth 10 points at the end of the game. Whenever a player plays exactly four letter-tiles from is rack, he can take one big chip from a chosen opponent.
148918.name: Scriba

148920.name: Cyber-Fate
148920.description:
From publisher blurb:

A cyberpunk setting for FATE, with the core FATE rules baked in. Fate is a generic role-playing game system designed to offer the least possible obstruction to role-playing. Fate has a large number of innovative gaming mechanics. This game includes the Fate core rules and a cyberpunk setting in one integrated package.

Cyber-Fate is set on Earth in the future when city sprawl covers huge areas of the planet. Humanity has made the jump off planet, but only as far as Mars. It's a dangerous world, full of corporate goons, street samurai, androids, towering cities and toxic weather.

This distinctive background, with a gritty, cyberpunk feel, integrates beautifully with the Fate rules to create an intense future-dystopia where the GM's and players' imaginations can run wild.

This PDF includes everything needed to start playing, with character creation rules, a timeline showing how the world got so messed up, a list of megacorporations, gear, cybernetics, and vehicles.

So start exploring this cyberpunk version of FATE now!

148921.name: Recca no Honoo: Flame of Recca
148921.description:
User Summary

Flame of Recca (Japanese: 烈火の炎 Hepburn: Rekka no Honō?) is a manga series written and illustrated by Nobuyuki Anzai, which was adapted into an anime series spanning forty-two episodes by Studio Pierrot. The series has also been adapted into two video games; Flame of Recca for the Game Boy Advance and Flame of Recca Final Burning for the PlayStation 2. [from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flame_of_Recca]

Recca Hanabishi, the main character, is a teenage boy who is obsessed with ninjas. During the game you have to fight enemies Tekken-style and earn new attacks after each win.

148923.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Eternal Duelist Soul
148923.description:
Yu-Gi-Oh! The Eternal Duelist Soul is a Yu-Gi-Oh! video game for the Game Boy Advance. Gameplay is similar to standard dueling rules, except that the Side Deck allows less than 15 cards, and is more for convenience of getting to cards for your Deck than switching between duels, as CPU duels are single duels rather than matches (with some exceptions in events).

Source: Yu-Gi-Oh! Wikia, "Yu-Gi-Oh! The Eternal Duelist Soul", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

148924.name: SD Gundam G Generation Advance
148924.description:
User Summary

Super Deformed (SD) Gundam Advance is the first G generation game for the Gameboy Advance system.
Advance includes many Gundam series, movies, and sidestories in its plot even though it mostly surrounds the One Year War of the Universal Century Timeline and the war in Gundam SEED on the Cosmic Era timeline.

Before going into battle, you can prepare your battleship and assign pilots to mobile suits. Then it's fighting time.

148926.name: 99 Action & Arcade
148926.description:
From the packaging

99 Games of the most popular genres!

99 action and arcade games with stunning graphics, addictive gameplay and numerous game options, suitable for all ages

• All games designed specifically for Windows XP
• Lots of game options, graphics effects and bonuses!
• Genres include racing, shooting, flying, combat ..
• Fast, eye- catching and plain old fun!

User Summary
What you get when you install this package are ten separate game types, each with ten game variants. That's actually one hundred games, not the ninety-nine promised in the title, (I guess the number ninety-nine just sounded catchier to the marketing department). There's a single menu screen from which the player chooses the game type and the game level. On this screen there are two additonal windows, one displays the objectives and the game controls while the second window displays a screen shot.

There is no high score table for any of these games, no pause, no save game facility and no automatic progression from one 'game' to the next, nor is there any in-game help text. It is also noticeable that the games re-use the same graphics, for example the tanks in the first two games fire the same missiles that are used in both JP-Flight and Up Shooter, the player's ship in Asteroid Hunter is one of the enemy ships in JP-Flight and so-on.
The games you get in this product are:

Tank Battle:





This game consists of ten levels each lasting twenty or thirty minutes, though the objectives change in each level they're all basically the same - defeat the enemy tanks and survive until the time runs out.

Tank Duel:





This game is very similar to Tank Battle and uses the same controls. Here the player's team must destroy the enemy team over a series of ten or fifteen minute rounds. The game consists of locating a tank in the game area and destroy it. It will be replaced and the process continues until the round countdown timer expires at which point the timer is reset and the the next round starts immediately, the process continues until the final round is over.

JP-Flight Space Shooter





This game is a keyboard controlled Space Invader style game where enemies advance down the screen in ranks and the player must eliminate them. All the games are the same but with minor variations, game two introduces bonuses (which may or may not help), in level three the enemy has an asteroid field to protect them and so on.

The player has five lives and ten thousand health points. Health points are lost when the player takes a hit or collides with an enemy but points can be scored by destroying enemy craft. The longer each game progresses the harder it becomes to destroy an enemy ship, what was once destroyed by a single hit may take two, three or more hits to destroy.
In the end the player just cannot shoot fast enough so either they lose all remaining lives/health to an indestructable screen ful of ships or one of the ships lands.

Asteroid Hunter





This game is a variation on Asteroids. There are ten game variations in which the sole objective is to destroy asteroids, when all asteroids are destroyed another set appears. Some games give the player has wingmen who assist in the destruction and there may be bonus items to be collected that increase or decrease the player's health points and can provide short periods of invulnerability. The arrow keys are used to steer the ship and the mouse is used to aim and fire. The game continues until the player runs out of lives and health points.

Planet Defender





This game to is a variation on Asteroid Hunter, however here the player must protect a planet from the onslaught of rocks. The game uses the same controls and bonuses as Asteroid Hunter so game play is very similar. Later levels introduce multiple planets, space stations and enemy spacecraft. The player starts with five lives and ten thousand health points which are decreased when the spaceship hits an asteroid and the planet starts with thirty thousand health points which are eroded as it is struck by rocks. The game ends when the planet is destroyed or the player runs out of health points and lives.

Up-Shooter





This game is a Galaxian style game. Enemies swoop across and down the screen and the player must eliminate them. Gameplay continues until the player runs out of lives and health while the longer the game goes on the enemies become harder to destroy.

Robot Arena




Here the player controls a robot, a kind of tracked vehicle, and drives it around a maze. The player starts unarmed and must collect lasers, cannon, etc by finding them in the maze. There are ten levels, one of which is a five minute survival game where the player's bot is unarmed, the remainder ar all twenty or thirty miutes long and have the same "destroy opposing robots to score points" objective. As with other games in this compilation the arrow keys steer the robot and the mouse aims the weapon.

Space Race





Here the player has to race around a track that consists of a tunnel made from hoops suspended in space. The mouse steers the craft while the forward/backward arrow keys control the speed.

Cannon Shoot





In the early levels tanks pass from left to right and the player must destroy a fixed number within the time period of the game, for example the objective in game one is to destroy 300 tanks in 20 minutes to win while not allowing more that 150 tanks to sneak by. Games 5-10 take the action into space with enemy ships and asteroids to shoot at. Some enemy tanks/spacecraft/rocks will attack the player but most will not. The game is over if the player loses all five lives or if too of the designated enemy escape.

Interceptor





A never ending line of enemy craft fly across the top of the screen dropping bombs, bricks and so on. The player's craft shoots both forward and sideways simultaneously and the objective is to to achieve a high score by destroying as many craft and bombs as possible. Later levels give the player buildings to defend, move the action into space, or limit the players ammunition, requiring that the player visits the bottom right corner to reload.

148927.name: Zor Draxtau (Issue 3 - July 2012)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
148927.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

The Aquatic Troll; salt water amd fresh water dwelling trolls.
The Giant Marine Iguana; a 20 ft long version of the Galapagos Island inhabitant, and companion for the aquatic troll.
Xerksis, the Mage-King; if you're running the Bone-Hilt Sword campaign, and would like more information on this unseen atagonist, this article will fill in the gaps of what has not been spoken aloud thus far.
Applying Color; a multi-part article in which I detail how color is applied to the artworks that appear in Usherwood publications.




Greetings gamers. Zor Draxtau is the periodic newsletter of the Usherwood Adventures campaign setting that highlights changes and updates to the campaign setting, OGC content otherwise only available in one of the adventures, special newsletter-only discounts on UA swag and POD products, editorials, and short articles of miscellaneous First Edition/OSRIC interest.

148928.name: Daemoni
148928.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Daemoni are the monsters of Eastern Europe. Chosen from the Breeding Pens, a dark and deep dungeon of unspeakable horrors, Daemoni breed together mortal Thralls in order to get the "perfect specimen," Turning only the most valued subjects. As such, all Daemoni start off on The Heart of the Vampire code and have no humanity what-so-ever.

The Daemoni walk the shadows of the world as Blood Sorcerors using their magicks to maintain order in the vampiric world. Acting as judges enforcing the Blood Laws, no one knows when a Daemoni will be in one territory or the next.

Wielding their powerful Dark Gift of Viscerorr, a Daemoni may change his body from liquid blood to any monstrous form he wishes. Inspired by stories of Dracula, Vlad the Impailer and Nazi experiments we've taken anew twist on horror with Daemoni!

In this Sourcebook you will discover how to play one of the most dangerous vampires to walk the earth. Coming from the ancient world, Daemoni strike fear in elders and Traditionalists alike. Learn how to wield Blood Magic and strike fear in your prey, polymorph your face into a horrific maw or shapechange your hands into bladed talons, the skies the limit when you play as a Daemoni.

148929.description: Painted fish to replace the cubes of the game.
boardgameaccessory: Fleet
Fleet: Arctic Bounty
148929.name: Fleet: Fish Meeples

148931.description:
Coup: Reformation, an expansion for the original version of Coup: City State from La Mame Games, adds new cards to the game and rules for factions and team play that increases tension in the early stages for four or more players and (thanks to 15 additional character cards) allows Coup to be better played with up to ten players.

With Coup: Reformation, each player must declare himself either Catholic (Loyalist in the second edition) or Protestant (Resistance) and can target only members of the other faction. Conversion is possible, however, for yourself or for another player by paying a charitable donation to the Almshouse (Treasury). Like all factions, once you have eliminated or converted the other group, you just descend into in-fighting, so there's still only one winner and no second place.

Coup: Reformation adds a new fluid team dynamic to Coup as players jostle with their allegiance to take advantage or seek protection in the early stages of the game.
148931.name: Coup: Reformation
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 019 – I, Geek Interviews Rikki Tahta
Episode 46- Patchistory and RobbCon 2015
The Game Pit: Episode 40 - Council Chamber Mega Review of 2014 with Top 5s
The Long View: Coup

148932.name: Primeval Companion
148932.description:
From publisher blurb:

More dinosaurs. More secrets. More action.

More Primeval.

The Primeval Companion expands your game by adding more options and adventures. Face a host of new dinosaurs like the ferocious Balaur or the vicious Tree Creeper. Learn how to survive in the wilderness, how to escape natural disasters, and how to deal with sinister conspiracies.

Two new Campaign Frameworks – The Village and Operation GEORGE – open up exciting new ways to play Primeval. Can you stop the Anomalies without the resources of the ARC, or without modern technology?

Finally, we’ve crammed three ready-to-run adventures into the Companion. Find out what happened to the missing train in The Devil & Mr. Sutton, solve the Message Found In An Anomaly and learn the secrets of the Earth Serpent!

148933.name: Basketball Sport Bag Dice Game
148933.description:
A dice game for simulating a game of basketball. There are 4 six-sided dice included, 2 for the Home Team and 2 for the Visiting Team (1 Offense die and 1 Defense die for each). Players take turns rolling their Offensive die against their opponent's Defense die. Points are scored by comparing the rolls against a chart.

Comes with a miniature duffel bag to store the dice.

148934.name: SpellForce 2: Faith in Destiny
148934.description:
Set before SpellForce 2: Faith in Destiny, The Golden Fool remains true to the RPG and RTS genre. Delving deeper into the SpellForce world, the DLC explores the story of the game of stones, Drakkar.
In the second of three DLC’s, players can now join in the bitter battle as Carla, one of the non-playable characters from the main game with the aim to win back the legendary “Golden Fool” stone. The stone, of which only one is in existence, defeats every other stone and ensures the holder will forever be the Drakkar champion.

“Each DLC offers players a different twist on the tale through elaborating on the backgrounds of those characters that are non-playable in the main game,” said Gennaro Giani, Localization and Production Manager at Nordic Games. “We’ve packed The Golden Fool with challenging puzzles and tricky situations that will flummox even the most experienced of puzzle solvers.

Set in the Tuscari Desert, the game has a genuine SpellForce feel where the thirst for power is now greater than ever. The Golden Fool is the most precious stone in Amun Kar’s game of stones where players must risk everything to regain it along with Carla’s reputation as the game of stones champion.

SpellForce 2: Faith in Destiny was released for PC in June. Joining forces with a group of diverse heroes and a dragon as trustful companions, players fight to gain information about this mysterious new enemy and thereby discover their own true destiny. Players assume the role of a young man who is supposed to release the entire world of Eo from the threat of a new and nameless evil.

Source: The Publisher Website.

148935.name: Brave the Labyrinth (Issue 1 - Jul 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Dirty Secrets of the Mage's Guild
148935.description:
Table of Contents:

Beetle Notes and Reader Mail..................1
Symac the Subverter...........................2
Dirty Secrets of the Mage's Guild.............5
The Catacombs.................................7
The Sunland Society...........................8
New Magic Items..............................10
Animal Retainers.............................11
Character Sheet..............................15
Better Than Starving.........................17
The Screams from Jedder's Hole...............18
Beetle Reviews...............................23

148936.name: 1250+ games
videogameversion: English/European Windows CD-ROM Jewel Case edition
English/European Windows CD-ROM Keep Case edition
148936.description:
From the packaging

1250+ GAMES

A boredom bonanza double CD packed full of every game imaginable, whether you're into Boogaloopers, Necrodome, Blob Factory or AA Bugswat. There's definitely something here for everyone!

Play your classic favourites and pit your wits against the computer to win at Chess, bridge, Back Gammon, or Solitaire. Why not even take a trip down memory lane and play he old zap 'en down space invaders that became a national addiction.

Think you're a real gaming whiz? Only real experts will have played tis full catalogue of games. If you're into strategy, word, card, board or educational games and sports simulations, then this CD has got to be the one for you.

Be spoilt for choice with 10 invincible categories:
• Adventure & War Games
• Sport Simulations
• Strategy Games
• Word Games
• Arcade Games
• Board Games
• Card & Dice Games
• Casino Games
• Educational Games
• Solitaire Games
